{{Infobox Person | name = Amy Bulley | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = 20 April, 1852 | birth_place = [[Minera|New Brighton]] | death_date = 16 November, 1939 | death_place = [[Bushey]] | death_cause = | residence = | other_names = | known_for = | education = [[Girton College]] and [[Newnham College]] | employer = [[Manchester High School for Girls]] | occupation = | title = | party = | boards = | spouse = Joseph Brooke | relatives = | signature = | website = | footnotes = | nationality = [[United Kingdom]] }} '''Amy Bulley''' or '''Agnes Amy Bulley; Amy Brooke''' (20 April 1852 – 16 November 1939) was an [[United Kingdom|English]] promoter of [[Female education|women's education]]. She was an early student at both [[Girton College]] and [[Newnham College]] and one of the first two students to sit the [[Tripos|tripos examinations]] in Cambridge. She entered education where she helped to create a "women's department" at what would be [[Manchester University]]. She wrote about [[women's rights]] and the growth of "white blouse" employment.
==Life== Bulley was born in [[Minera|New Brighton]] near [[Wrexham]] in 1852. She was one fourteen children and one of the three daughters who were unusually sent to college. Her two sisters went to the newly founded [[Newnham College]] whilst Amy went to [[Girton College]]. After three years she moved to Newnham College where she could join her sisters and complete a fourth year. The principal of Newnham, [[Anne Jemima Clough]], was a friend of their parents and she had persuaded Mr and Mary Rachel Bulley to send their daughters south. Bulley and [[Mary Paley]] were the first women to take the tripos examination at [[Cambridge University]]. The people who delivered Paley and Bulley's papers were [[Henry Sidgwick]], [[John Venn]], [[Sedley Taylor]] and Paley's future husband [[Alfred Marshall]]. She took the Tripos in 1874, and had she been a man then she would have been awarded a second class degree but this was denied her because she was a woman. They sat the exams in Professor [[Benjamin Hall Kennedy]]'s drawing room. Paley described how Professor Kennedy would sometimes doze whilst [[Exam invigilator|invigilating]]. Paley created a sketch of Sedley Taylor delivering the exam papers.<ref name="Sutherland2006">{{cite book|author=Gill Sutherland|title=Faith, Duty, and the Power of Mind: The Cloughs and Their Circle, 1820-1960|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=o-jeNIa9LjYC&pg=PA106|date=17 March 2006|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=978-0-521-86155-7|page=106}}</ref>
In 1876 she became an [[Schoolmaster|assistant mistress]] at [[Manchester High School for Girls]] where she taught and in her spare time gave support to the growing demand for more higher education for girls.<ref name=odnb>Linda Walker, ‘Bulley , (Agnes) Amy (1852–1939)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004; online edn, Jan 2010 [http://www.oxforddnb.com/view/article/48686, accessed 22 Feb 2017]</ref> The Manchester and Salford College for Women was founded in 1876. This was not an easy task as the girls involved found the work difficult as they had not been prepared for higher education. Numbers grew slowly from 46 to 50 and by 1883 there were eighty students. The college was now operating and this created sufficient pressure on the [[Victoria University of Manchester|Owens College]] that it created a women's department in 1883. Bulley served as secretary to the college and despite her interventions only a few students would attend examinations because of the fear of failure. Bulley arranged for students to stay behind to have tea with her as she knew that they would normally return straight home and not enjoy any camaraderie.<ref name="Tylecote1941">{{cite book|author=Mabel Phythian Tylecote|title=The Education of Women at Manchester University, 1883-1933|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MBkNAQAAIAAJ&pg=PA23|year=1941|publisher=Manchester University Press|pages=20–25|id=GGKEY:GTG8HH8X98D}}</ref>
Bulley took an interest in worker's rights when she left Manchester High School for Girls in 1886. She switched careers to journalism where she wrote for the [[Manchester Guardian]]. The switch was possible because she had already established a reputation for writing when she had written ''Middle Class Education in England'' in 1881.<ref name=odnb/> In 1894 she and Margaret Whitley published "Women's Work".<ref name="BulleyWhitley1894">{{cite book|author1=Agnes Amy Bulley|author2=Margaret Whitley|title=Women's Work|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=WbZOAAAAMAAJ|year=1894|publisher=Methuen}}</ref>
In 1907 she married Joseph Brooke who had been her dead sister Mary's husband. Three years later, her botanist brother, [[Arthur Bulley]] stood for parliament on behalf of the [[women's suffrage]] movement.<ref name="Crawford2003">{{cite book|author=Elizabeth Crawford|title=The Women's Suffrage Movement: A Reference Guide 1866-1928|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=a2EK9P7-ZMsC&pg=PA333|date=2 September 2003|publisher=Routledge|isbn=1-135-43402-6|pages=333}}</ref> When her husband died in 1912 she moved to Bushey in Hertfordshire where she died in 1939.<ref name=odnb/>
==Selected works== * ''Middle Class Education in England'', (1881) * ''Domestic service: a social study'', Westminster Review (1891) * ''Report on the employment of women'' Fortnightly Review, (1894) * ''Women's Work'' with [[Margaret Whitley]], (1894)<ref name="BulleyWhitley1894"/> * ''The political evolution of women'', Westminster Review, (1890) * ''Edwin Waugh, the Lancashire poet'', (Temple Bar, October 1890) * ''The Eucharist'' (anthropology) (1910)<ref name=odnb/> * ''The Peace Song of Ireland'' (Song)(1911)

{{about|the singer|the album|Anastacia (album)|other uses|Anastasia (disambiguation)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2013}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Anastacia | image = Anastacia-4006.jpg | caption = Anastacia at the SWR3 New Pop Festival 2017 | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Anastacia Lyn Newkirk | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1968|9|17}} | birth_place = [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], U.S.
| Genre = {{Flatlist| * [[Pop rock]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/all-about/anastacia|access-date=18 August 2018|title=Anastacia|website=Mirror|date=1 June 2018}}</ref> * [[blue eyed soul]]<ref name="The New York Times">{{cite web|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2000/07/05/style/05iht-records.t.html| title = A Few Good Sounds for Summer| website = [[The New York Times]]|quote=Anastacia is a young blue-eyed soul singer and songwriter of some poise and considerable promise from New York|author=Mike Zwerin}}</ref> * [[dance-pop]]<ref name="AM">{{Allmusic|artist|mn0000031442|Anastacia}}</ref> }} | instrument = Vocals | occupation = {{Flatlist| * Singer-songwriter * [[record producer]] * dancer * fashion designer * mentor * [[philanthropist]] }} | years_active = 1993–present | label = {{Flatlist| * [[Epic Records|Epic]] * [[Mercury Records|Mercury]] * [[BMG Rights Management|BMG Rights]] * [[Sony Music]] * [[Universal Music Group]] }} | associated_acts = {{Flatlist| *[[Luciano Pavarotti]] *[[Elton John]] *[[Eros Ramazzotti]] *[[Chaka Khan]] *[[Michael Jackson]] *[[Natalia Druyts]] *[[Ben's Brother]] *[[Dima Bilan]] *[[Celine Dion]] *[[Jon Bon Jovi]] *[[David Morales]] *[[Faith Evans]] *[[Jamiroquai]] *[[Auryn]] }} | website = {{URL|http://anastacia.com/}} }}
'''Anastacia Lyn Newkirk''' (born September 17, 1968) is an American singer-songwriter, producer and former dancer. Her first two albums ''[[Not That Kind]]'' (2000) and ''[[Freak of Nature]]'' (2001) were released in quick succession to major success. Spurred on by the multi-platinum, global smash "[[I'm Outta Love]]", Anastacia was awarded as the 'World's Best-Selling New Female Pop Artist' in 2001. Her commercial success continued with international hits such as "[[Paid My Dues]]", "[[One Day in Your Life (Anastacia song)|One Day In Your Life]]" and the official song of the [[2002 FIFA World Cup]], "[[Boom (Anastacia song)|Boom]]". After recovering from cancer, she returned with 2004's ''[[Anastacia (album)|Anastacia]]'' which deviated from previous albums into pop-rock. Peaking at number one in 11 countries, it became Europe's second biggest selling album of the year. Its lead single "[[Left Outside Alone]]" remained at number one on the European ''Billboard'' chart for 15 weeks and helped Anastacia launch the most successful European tour by a solo artist that same year.<ref name="anastacia.com" /><ref name="anastacia.com">[http://www.anastacia.com/infos/view/bio Anastacia bio] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120108043930/http://www.anastacia.com/infos/view/bio |date=January 8, 2012 }} (December 2011)</ref> The album also spawned another three singles: "[[Sick and Tired (Anastacia song)|Sick and Tired]]", "[[Welcome to My Truth]]", and "[[Heavy on My Heart]]".
In 2005, the multi-platinum compilation project ''[[Pieces of a Dream (album)|Pieces of a Dream]]'' was released which spawned the chart topping duet with [[Eros Ramazzotti]], "[[I Belong to You (Il Ritmo della Passione)]]". Her fourth studio album ''[[Heavy Rotation (Anastacia album)|Heavy Rotation]]'' (2008) produced the songs "[[Absolutely Positively]]", "[[Defeated (song)|Defeated]]", and "[[I Can Feel You]]". Her cover album ''[[It's a Man's World (Anastacia album)|It's a Man's World]]'' (2012) was followed by a sixth studio album ''[[Resurrection (Anastacia album)|Resurrection]]'' (2014), which reached the top ten in the European charts. Her ''[[Ultimate Collection (Anastacia album)|Ultimate Collection]]'' was released in 2015 and peaked in the top ten of the UK charts, giving the singer her sixth top ten album in Britain. In 2017, Anastacia released her new studio album ''[[Evolution (Anastacia album)|Evolution]]'' and its lead single "[[Caught in the Middle (Anastacia song)|Caught In The Middle]]".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/anastacia-is-releasing-her-new-single-caught-in-the-middle-this-week-and-its-one-of-her-trademark-power-anthems__19782/|title=Anastacia is back with a brand new power anthem: Preview|access-date=2018-07-29|language=en}}</ref> Anastacia has established herself as one of the best selling international female singers of the 2000s and 2010s. As of 2016, she has reported world-wide sales of more than 50 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://top40-charts.com/artist.php?aid=413|title=Anastacia Biography, Discography, Chart History|publisher=}}</ref> She has had five top ten singles on U.S. ''[[Billboard charts|Billboard]]''<nowiki/>'s Dance Club chart and three albums on Top Album Sales chart.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/anastacia/chart-history/dance-club-play-songs|title=Anastacia Chart History|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-07-22}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/anastacia/chart-history/top-album-sales|title=Anastacia Chart History|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-07-22}}</ref>
Known for her powerful [[mezzo-soprano]] voice and her small stature of {{convert|5|ft|2|in|cm}}, she has been dubbed "the little lady with the big voice".<ref name="Wilde">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/home/moslive/article-1100863/I-really-dont-like-music-says-Anastasia-happens-sold-20m-albums.html|title='I really don't like music,' says Anastacia (who happens to have sold 20 million albums)|work=Daily Mail|first=Jon|last=Wilde|accessdate=November 11, 2011|date=December 27, 2008|location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url = http://www.latimes.com/business/realestate/hot-property/la-fi-hotprop-anastacia-20160414-story.html| title = Singer Anastacia is taking her longtime Beverly Hills home off her tour circuit| work=[[Los Angeles Times]]| date=18 April 2016| accessdate=11 March 2018| first=Lauren| last=Beale}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url = http://renownedforsound.com/index.php/album-review-anastacia-evolution/| title = ALBUM REVIEW: ANASTACIA – EVOLUTION| work=Renowned for Sound| date=4 October 2017| accessdate=11 March 2018| first=Haydon| last=Benfield}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url = http://www.ukmusicreviews.co.uk/interviews/interview-anastacia/| title = Interview: Anastacia| work=UK Music Reviews| date=8 February 2017| accessdate=11 March 2018| first=Kevin| last=Cooper}}</ref> Also famed for her trademark glasses, she underwent corrective [[LASIK]] surgery in August 2005, although she still frequently wears them.
During her life Anastacia has battled many health problems. She was diagnosed with [[Crohn's disease]] at age 13, [[breast cancer]] at age 34, and [[supraventricular tachycardia]] at age 39. In 2013 Anastacia was diagnosed with breast cancer for a second time. On October 1, 2013 to coincide with Breast Cancer Awareness Month, Anastacia informed the media that she had undergone a double mastectomy.<ref name="ReferenceA">{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2440010/Anastacia-undergoes-double-mastectomy-diagnosed-breast-cancer-second-time.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | first=Sarah | last=Bull | title=Anastacia undergoes double mastectomy after being diagnosed with breast cancer for the second time | date=October 1, 2013}}</ref> In recognition of her decade-long charitable efforts in breast cancer awareness, Anastacia became only the second woman to be presented with the Humanitarian Award at the ''[[GQ]]'' Men of the Year Awards in 2013.<ref name="ReferenceB">{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2491771/Anastacia-makes-public-appearance-double-mastectomy--accept-award-raising-breast-cancer-awareness.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | first=Shyam | last=Dodge | title=Anastacia makes first public appearance after double mastectomy... to accept award for raising breast cancer awareness | date=November 8, 2013}}</ref>
==Career==
===1968–1998: Early life and career beginnings=== Anastacia was born in Chicago, Illinois;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.anastacia.com/biography |title=Official Website : Biography |publisher=Anastacia |accessdate=September 26, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111003005112/http://www.anastacia.com/biography |archivedate=October 3, 2011 |df=mdy }}</ref> her late father Robert Newkirk (of German descent) was a club-singer and her mother Diane Hurley (of Irish descent) an actress on Broadway.<ref>[http://anastacia-unlimited.org/interview12.php] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081122141350/http://anastacia-unlimited.org/interview12.php|date=November 22, 2008}}</ref> After her father (a sufferer of [[bipolar disorder]])<ref>{{cite web|title=Anastacia interview: Welcome to my truth|url=http://www.scotsman.com/what-s-on/music/anastacia-interview-welcome-to-my-truth-1-1301248|work=The Scotsman|publisher=Johnston Publishing Ltd.|accessdate=August 22, 2013|date=November 14, 2008}}</ref> left the Newkirk family, they moved to New York City when she was a teenager.<ref name="Times 2005"/> Then she enrolled at the [[Professional Children's School]] in [[Manhattan]].<ref name="BiographyChannel"/>
Anastacia was diagnosed with [[Crohn's disease]]<ref name="Times 2005"/><ref name="MTVCancer"/> when she was thirteen. The incurable bowel disease led to an operation where surgeons cut directly through her stomach muscles removing a foot of the singer's intestines, causing Anastacia to be wheelchair bound and needing to learn how to walk again.<ref name="dailymail.co.uk">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-1195924/My-health-issues-easily-killed-says-Anastacia--I-refuse-scarred-life.html|title=My health issues could easily have killed me, says Anastacia... but I refuse to be scarred for life|date=June 29, 2009|work=Daily Mail|first=Hilary|last=Freeman|accessdate=January 2, 2012|location=London}}</ref> Despite her illness she soon became interested in dance.<ref name="dailymail.co.uk"/> At age 19, a diet triggered a Crohn's relapse.<ref name="dailymail.co.uk"/>
Despite her ongoing health problems Anastacia continued to pursue her ambitions for the next decade. Anastacia started her career in 1983<ref name="mtv.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/artists/anastcia/ |title=Anastácia | New Music And Songs |publisher=MTV |date= |accessdate=2014-06-06}}</ref> as a dancer for hire. Her first claim to fame was as a professional dancer (dancer for hire), making regular appearances in the mid-1980s and early-90s on MTV's ''[[Club MTV]]''. She appeared in a two videos for American hip hop trio [[Salt-n-Pepa]] (''Get Up Everybody (Get Up)'' in 1988 and ''Twist and Shout'' in 1989).<ref name="BiographyChannel">{{cite web|title=Anastacia Biography |url=http://www.thebiographychannel.co.uk/biographies/anastacia.html |work=Bio. |publisher=AETN UK |accessdate=August 22, 2013 |quote=The young Anastacia battled against Crohn's disease to develop a career in dance and can be spotted in the early Salt-N-Pepa videos 'Everybody Get Up' and 'Twist and Shout'. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921145708/http://www.thebiographychannel.co.uk/biographies/anastacia.html |archivedate=September 21, 2013 }}</ref> In 1990, she started her musical career as a backing vocalist. She sang back-up vocals on pop star [[Tiffany (American singer)|Tiffany]]'s ''[[New Inside]]'' album in 1990. In 1991, she featured in music video ''My Fallen Angel'' of Dominican singer/actor [[Coro (singer)|Coro]]. In 1992 she gained her first break as a solo singer on [[Black Entertainment Television|BET]]'s ''[[ComicView]]'', singing [[Oleta Adams]]' "Get Here".<ref>{{cite tweet|user=AnastaciaMusic|author=Anastacia|number=53749838063472640|date=1 April 2011|title=Wow so true. RT @eTom24: @AnastaciaFanily Wikipedia says: in 1992 you performed Oleta Adam's 'Get Here' on BET's Comic View, true?}}</ref> In 1993 she moved to Los Angeles to record the song ''One More Chance'' for the producer OG Pierce, it resulted however in no record deal. That same year the singer recorded a collaboration with [[David Morales]] called "[[Forever Luv]]", again however Anastacia failed to get a record deal. Throughout the mid 90s although producers claimed to be intrigued by her voice's unusual tone, Anastacia would be continuously told that 'her sound just didn't quite fit into any category'. In 1994, she sang back-up vocals on [[Jamie Foxx]] debut album ''[[Peep This]]'', and in 1995 Anastacia sang back-up vocals on [[Paula Abdul]]'s third studio album ''[[Head over Heels (Paula Abdul album)|Head Over Heels]]''. By 1997, Anastacia had become the member of a band called ''The Kraze'' which she remained a part of until 1999. In 1997 she also sung in the background choir for [[Kurt Carr]]'s gospel [[vocal ensemble]] called The Kurt Carr Singers on their album ''No One Else''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.anastacia-archive.de/cds/|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20130909101846/http://www.anastacia-archive.de/cds/|deadurl=yes|title=CD’s - Anastacia-Archive.de|date=September 9, 2013|archivedate=September 9, 2013|publisher=}}</ref> She had two duet songs with [[Cuba]]n [[composer]] [[Omar Sosa]] in 1998, performing "Mi Negra, Tu Bombón" and "Tienes Un Solo" in 1999.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/search/xx/music/pid/1206780/a/spirit+of+the+roots.htm |title=Omar Sosa – Spirit of the Roots CD Album |publisher=Cduniverse.com |date=1999-01-26 |accessdate=2014-06-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tRIfyRL6aTU |title=anastacia tienes un solo |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-08-29 |accessdate=2014-06-06}}</ref> Eventually in 1998, before turning 30, Anastacia attracted the interest of record labels after making the finals of the short-lived [[MTV]] talent show ''[[The Cut (1998 TV series)|The Cut]]''.<ref name="Times 2005"/> Anastacia signed a contract with [[Daylight Records]], a custom label of [[Sony Music Entertainment]]'s [[Epic Records]] in March 1999.
===1998–2001: ''Not That Kind''=== Anastacia met Lisa Braude (who later became her manager) in 1997. She encouraged her to join [[MTV]]'s talent show ''[[The Cut (1998 TV series)|The Cut]]'' in 1998. She made her way to be one of the ten finalists, performing her own composition entitled "[[Not That Kind (song)|Not That Kind]]". Even though she did not win the contest, she had successfully impressed some notable artists, such as [[Elton John]] and [[Michael Jackson]] as well as the show's judges that included [[David Foster]] and [[Faith Evans]]. This afterwards led her to sign with [[Daylight Records|Daylight]], one of [[Epic Records|Epic]]'s labels, by March 1999. Backed up by leading American producer/writers, she released her debut album, ''[[Not That Kind]]'' on June 13, 2000. The album reached the top ten in eight countries in Europe and Asia. It went four times platinum in Europe and triple platinum in Australia;<ref name="Australian Certifications 2000">{{cite web|url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/aria-charts-accreditations-albums-2000.htm |title=Australian Certifications 2000 |publisher=[[Australian Recording Industry Association|ARIA]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110611211848/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/aria-charts-accreditations-albums-2000.htm |archivedate=June 11, 2011 |df=mdy }}</ref> her debut single "[[I'm Outta Love]]" was a global smash hit in 2000, topping the charts in Belgium, Australia and New Zealand, peaking at number two in France,<ref name="Anastacia-I'm Outta Love">{{cite web|url=http://dutchcharts.nl//showitem.asp?interpret=Anastacia&titel=I%27m+Outta+Love&cat=s |title=Anastacia-I'm Outta Love |publisher=Dutch Charts.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140328195045/http://dutchcharts.nl//jaaroverzichten.asp?year=2013&cat=s |archivedate=March 28, 2014 |df=mdy }}</ref> Switzerland, Italy and Ireland as well as also reaching number six both in Germany<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ki.informatik.uni-wuerzburg.de/~topsi/deu2000/deu_aug00.html|title=German Top 20 – The Chart Of August 2000 |publisher=Infinity Charts:}}</ref> and the UK.<ref name="UK Top 40 Hit Database">{{cite web|url=http://www.everyhit.com/searchsec.php |title=UK Top 40 Hit Database |publisher=everyhit.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081012195559/http://www.everyhit.com/searchsec.php |archivedate=October 12, 2008 |df=mdy }}</ref> In the U.S., it was only a minor radio hit. The second single "[[Not That Kind (song)|Not That Kind]]" reached number 11 in the UK<ref name="UK Top 40 Hit Database"/> and became a top 10 hit in Italy. It also entered the top 20 in Switzerland and France.<ref name="Anastacia-Not That Kind (Single)">{{cite web|url=http://dutchcharts.nl//showitem.asp?interpret=Anastacia&titel=Not+That+Kind&cat=s |title=Anastacia-Not That Kind (Single) |publisher=Dutch Charts.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140328195045/http://dutchcharts.nl//jaaroverzichten.asp?year=2013&cat=s |archivedate=March 28, 2014 |df=mdy }}</ref> "[[Cowboys & Kisses]]" was released as the third single from the album, charting in the top forty in some European countries. As the last promotional only single, "[[Made for Lovin' You (Anastacia song)|Made for Lovin' You]]" charted in the UK at number twenty-seven and in France at number seventy-two. While "I'm Outta Love" was a top ten hit on the [[Hot Dance Club Songs|Hot Dance Club Play]] chart in the United States, "Not That Kind" did not chart on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]; however by the end of the year Anastacia would go on to be the World's Best Selling New Female Pop Artist at the [[2001 World Music Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DRQEAAAAMBAJ|title=Billboard|first=Nielsen Business Media|last=Inc|date=June 2, 2001|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.|via=Google Books}}</ref>
===2001–2006: ''Freak of Nature'', ''Anastacia'', breast cancer diagnosis and ''Pieces of a Dream''=== Anastacia's second album ''[[Freak of Nature]]'', released in November 2001, achieved successful sales in the UK where it went triple platinum as well as being a hit throughout continental Europe, however unlike her debut it did not match the same level of international success. The first single released was "[[Paid My Dues]]". The song became an overall hit, in 2001, peaking in Denmark, Italy, Norway, and Switzerland, and reaching the top ten in several other mainland European countries. The second single, released in 2002, "[[One Day in Your Life (Anastacia song)|One Day in Your Life]]", reached number eleven in the UK and the top ten in many European countries. The next single "[[Why'd You Lie to Me]]" reached the top thirty in the UK. "[[You'll Never Be Alone]]", the fourth single, reached number twenty-eight on the [[Adult Contemporary (chart)|Adult Contemporary]] chart in the U.S. The album was finally released in the United States in May 2002. [[Lisa Lopes|Lisa "Left Eye" Lopes]], who had died in a car wreck the month before, was partly responsible for Anastacia's success, since Lisa hosted MTV's ''The Cut''. Soon after she released a double disc edition featuring two bonus hits, remixes for three of the tracks on the album and two live tracks taken from a Japan gig that was performed on the September 13, 2002.
Anastacia joined [[Celine Dion]], [[Shakira]], [[Cher]], [[Dixie Chicks]], and [[Stevie Nicks]] for ''[[VH1 Divas Live]]'' in 2002 and she also contributed the song "Love Is a Crime" to the ''[[Chicago (2002 film)|Chicago]]'' soundtrack.<ref name="MTVCancer">{{cite news|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|title=Anastacia Diagnosed With Breast Cancer|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1459603/anastacia-has-breast-cancer.jhtml|accessdate=August 22, 2013|newspaper=[[MTV]]|date=January 21, 2003}}</ref> The song peaked at number one on the Hot Dance Club Play chart and enjoyed moderate airplay on Rhythmic/Dance format. Anastacia was also asked to sing the official song for the [[2002 FIFA World Cup]] in South Korea and Japan and subsequently performed this at the opening ceremony.
In January 2003, Anastacia decided to have her [[breast reduction plasty|breasts reduced]] because of back strain. From a routine [[mammography|mammogram]] for the surgery she discovered she had breast cancer. She immediately started and successfully completed surgery and [[radiation therapy|radiotherapy]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Pop singer Anastacia undergoes cancer surgery|url=http://badgerherald.com/artsetc/2003/03/04/pop_singer_anastacia.php|accessdate=August 22, 2013|newspaper=The Badger Herald|date=March 4, 2003|agency=Reuters|location=Los Angeles}}</ref> Anastacia subsequently established the Anastacia Fund to promote awareness of breast cancer among younger women.<ref name="Times 2005">{{cite web|last=Barrell|first=Tony|title=The trials of Anastacia|url=http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/style/article152070.ece|work=[[The Sunday Times]]|publisher=Times Newspapers|accessdate=August 22, 2013|date=October 23, 2005}} {{subscription required|s}}</ref> She has attributed her health scare as being an inspiration for the sound and content of her third album. According to an interview she gave in 2005 on British music station [[The Box (UK and Ireland)|The Box]], her voice lost its power and she became unable to record, and thus she spent a long time writing and trying to create a sound that she finally became happy with.
[[File:Anastacia concert.jpg|thumb|left|Performing live in 2005]] As stated on the Australian talk show ''[[Rove (TV series)|Rove]]'' in 2004, Anastacia wanted to have more edge to her vocals as she felt there was something missing from her previous works. She brought in many rock instruments which brought a new atmosphere to her music. She also felt that she still needed the funkiness and the pop as the singer felt that too much edge would sound wrong with her voice. Out of this a new sound was formed. She describes her sound as Sprock—a combination of [[soul music|soul]], pop, and rock. She named the album after herself.
Anastacia entered record studios in September 2003 to begin recording her next album, working with [[Glen Ballard]], [[Dallas Austin]], and [[David A. Stewart]] for release in 2004. On the album, Anastacia also collaborated with [[P.O.D.]] lead singer [[Sonny Sandoval]] on the socially conscious track "I Do".
The first single, released in March, was "[[Left Outside Alone]]", which saw a change in direction for Anastacia. It was one of the biggest songs in Europe of 2004, reaching number one in Austria, Italy, Spain, and Switzerland; number two in Denmark, Germany, Ireland, the Netherlands, and Norway; and number three in the United Kingdom and Hungary. Overall the song remained at number one on the European ''Billboard'' singles chart for 15 weeks.<ref name="anastacia.com"/> The song also topped the Australian charts, Anastacia's second number one in the country, where it went on to become the second-biggest selling single of 2004.
''[[Anastacia (album)|Anastacia]]'' quickly became her most successful album to date, giving her a third consecutive triple platinum album in the UK and reaching the top of the national charts in Ireland, the Netherlands, Australia, Greece, Germany and other countries. Unlike her first two albums, which were released in her homeland of America, ''Anastacia'' was not, despite being scheduled for release on three occasions. "[[Left Outside Alone]]" was released twice, but failed to pick up heavy airplay.<ref name="BiographyChannel"/> It only gained sporadic [[Adult Contemporary (chart)|Adult Contemporary]] format airplay. Again, it sparked [[Rhythmic (chart)|Rhythmic/Dance]] format airplay and the dance mix of "Left Outside Alone" peaked at number five on the [[Hot Dance Club Songs|Hot Dance Club Play]] chart. After the original version of "Left Outside Alone" failed to catch on because of lukewarm promotion, especially on radio, the album was postponed and eventually cancelled after the release date of August 30, 2004 passed. Anastacia released three further internationally successful singles; "[[Sick and Tired (Anastacia song)|Sick and Tired]]" (which gave her another number one in Spain and another UK top five single), "[[Welcome to My Truth]]" (her best-selling hit in Spain), and the ballad "[[Heavy on My Heart]]", sales of which went towards the Anastacia Fund (a charitable organization providing [[research funding]] for breast cancer).
A small batch of [[Anastacia (album)|her self-titled album]] was released with a bonus DVD, poster and slip case. The DVD includes a making-of documentary, footage from her 2002 Europe Promo Tour, and a photo gallery. From September 2004 to August 2005, Anastacia embarked on the [[Live at Last Tour]]. In 2005 the tour was renamed the Encore Tour. The tour would become the second most popular tour of 2004 behind only U2.<ref name="anastacia.com"/>
In late 2005, she released her first greatest hits collection, called ''[[Pieces of a Dream (album)|Pieces of a Dream]]'', named after a track of the same name. The album spawned the hit singles "[[Pieces of a Dream (Anastacia song)|Pieces of a Dream]]", which peaked at number one in Spain, and the duet with [[Eros Ramazzotti]], "[[I Belong to You (Il Ritmo della Passione)]]", which was a number 1 hit in Germany, Hungary, Italy and Switzerland and a hit throughout continental Europe. Even though [[Sony BMG]] did force her to release this collection, Anastacia has said that she is happy now that it was created as it was like a "story book", or summary of the first six years of her career. In 2005, she was recognized for worldwide sales of over 20 million.<ref name="JME award">{{cite web|title=Anastacia, 20 million worldwide sales award |url=http://jmenternational.com/work/awards/2005/anastacia/ |work=JM Enternational |accessdate=August 22, 2013 |date=November 2, 2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004223432/http://jmenternational.com/work/awards/2005/anastacia/ |archivedate=October 4, 2013 }}</ref>
Not long after the release of "I Belong to You (Il Ritmo Della Passione)", Anastacia released her first live DVD ''[[Live at Last (Anastacia video)|Live at Last]]'' on March 27, 2006 in Europe. The DVD contains footage from concerts in Berlin and [[Munich]]. It includes music videos to her four singles; "[[Left Outside Alone]]", "[[Everything Burns]]", "Pieces of a Dream", and "I Belong to You (Il Ritmo Della Passione)", five alternative videos ("I Do", "Rearview", "Seasons Change", "Underground Army", and "[[Time (Anastacia song)|Time]]") to songs from her self-titled album, and a documentary about the tour. Soon after the DVD release Anastacia took a break from the music industry and began concentrating on her growing fashion line with s. Oliver.
=== 2007–2013: ''Heavy Rotation'', collaborations, ''It's a Man's World'' and second breast cancer === [[File:Heavy Rotation 3.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Anastacia performing live in 2009]] [[File:HR Tour 2.jpg|thumb|200px|right|«Heavy Rotation Tour»]] Anastacia attended the memorial [[Concert for Diana]] on July 1, 2007, which would have been on Diana's forty-sixth birthday. This was one of the first major events to take place in the new [[Wembley Stadium]], and one of her first major appearances since she took a break from the industry. She opened the medley section of the show and she sang a rendition of "[[Superstar (Jesus Christ Superstar song)|Superstar]]", from [[Andrew Lloyd Webber]]'s ''[[Jesus Christ Superstar]]'', with a [[gospel music|gospel]] chorus behind her.
In August 2007, a video was put on the "Anastacia by S. Oliver" web site. During the video, when Anastacia was asked about her future plans, she confirmed that she was working on a new album as well as the clothing line. A specific month of release or title was not mentioned.<ref>{{cite web|title=August 2007 video on the Anastacia section of the "Anastacia by s oliver" website|url=http://www.anastaciabysoliver.com/|publisher=Anastaciabysoliver.com|accessdate=February 21, 2013}}</ref> In November 2007, her biography on the official Anastacia website<ref name=OfficialBio>[http://www.anastacia.com/bio.html Biography page] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071205025217/http://www.anastacia.com/bio.html |date=December 5, 2007 }} Official Anastacia web site.</ref> was updated to say there would be a new album in 2008, with a tour to follow. During this time Anastacia began having palpitations which she believed were simple panic attacks; she was soon diagnosed with the heart condition [[supraventricular tachycardia]].<ref name="dailymail.co.uk"/> It was in this period also that Anastacia left Sony and moved to Mercury. During an interview for the UK breakfast show ''This Morning'', the singer cited that David Massey's move from Sony to Mercury was key to her own label change due to the fact that Massey had originally signed her and had been involved in all of her previous albums.
On July 24, Anastacia announced that her fourth studio album ''[[Heavy Rotation (Anastacia album)|Heavy Rotation]]'' would be released October 27, 2008 in Europe and Asia (and elsewhere in 2009). The new album featured collaborations with producers [[Ne-Yo]], The Heavyweights, [[Lester Mendez]], [[J.R. Rotem]], and [[Rodney Jerkins]] and was a noted departure from the pop rock sound of her previous material. The album's first single, called "[[I Can Feel You]]", began playing in some radio markets on August 25, 2008.<ref name="MTVAsia0808">[http://www.mtvasia.com/News/200808/21016468.html Anastacia Is Back With Fourth Studio Album 'Heavy Rotation'] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090319021444/http://www.mtvasia.com/News/200808/21016468.html |date=March 19, 2009 }}. (August 21, 2008) MTV Asia. Retrieved August 25, 2008.</ref> The second single from ''Heavy Rotation'' was "[[Absolutely Positively]]", later served as a promotional single only. The third official single from the album, "Defeated", was released as a promotional single in Europe without a music video.
Her fourth studio album proved to be less successful than her previous ones; her singles failed to reach the top 40 in her most commercially successful country (UK). Anastacia however remained positive, stating that other artists have faced the same problems while changing a record label, also blaming the world [[Great Recession|economical crisis]] and the label's decision to alter her sound from her own chosen sprock sound of her previous record to a more "urban feel". In later years Anastacia would publicly admit regret towards the change of sound, citing personal problems that led to a creative [[Selling out|sell-out]]. Regardless of the lack of commercial success, the album was ranked number ten on ''Billboard'' magazine's online "Readers' Poll: 10 Best Albums of 2008".
In 2009, the Women's World Award presented Anastacia with the World Artist Award, recognizing the singer's success and ongoing positive influence in pop music.
In June 2009, Anastacia began her second tour throughout Europe to promote her fourth studio album. The tour was funded by the singer herself, not her label, and was well received by critics and fans alike.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sullivan|first=Caroline|title=Pop review: Anastacia, Hammersmith Apollo, London|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2009/jun/27/anastacia-hammersmith-apollo-review|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=August 22, 2013|date=June 27, 2009}}</ref> In November and December 2009 Anastacia, [[Chaka Khan]] and [[Lulu (singer)|Lulu]] were headlining the ''[[Here Come the Girls (concert tour)|Here Come the Girls]]'' a special Christmas concert that visited the United Kingdom only.<ref>{{cite news|first=Lisa|last=Sewards |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1215917/Its-diva-fever-Lulus-hit-Shout--you-tour-Chaka-Khan-Anastacia.html |title=It's diva fever! Lulu's first hit was Shout... which is what you have to do if you go on tour with Chaka Khan and Anastacia |work=Daily Mail |location=London |date= September 25, 2009|accessdate=September 26, 2009}}</ref> On December 7, 2009 Anastacia opened the annual ''[[Royal Variety Performance]]'' with [[Lulu (singer)|Lulu]] and [[Chaka Khan]], performing a rendition of "[[Relight My Fire]]".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/lancashire/8398060.stm|title=Blackpool Royal Variety performers entertain Queen|publisher=BBC News|date=December 8, 2009|accessdate=December 17, 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091213124119/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/lancashire/8398060.stm|archivedate=December 13, 2009 <!--DASHBot-->|deadurl= no}}</ref> The tour was an overall success, selling out 24 shows.<ref name="anastacia.com"/> In October 2009, Anastacia released a collaborative single with British band [[Ben's Brother]] entitled "[[Stalemate (song)|Stalemate]]", which was included on the band's album ''Battling Giants''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bensbrother.com/shop.php |title=Battling Giants |website=Ben's Brother |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110707224209/http://www.bensbrother.com/shop.php |archive-date=July 7, 2011}}</ref>
During the winter of 2009, Anastacia once again joined [[Lulu (singer)|Lulu]] for the Here Come the Girls Tour with [[Heather Small]] replacing Chaka Khan. In March 2010, Anastacia again entered the recording studio. Around this time, she also headlined several shows at Art on Ice in [[Zürich]], the [[Hallenstadion]] and [[Lausanne]]. Her official website stated about the show: "In a unique, groundbreaking combination of Olympic-level figure skating and smash hit pop, the music of Anastacia will soundtrack and seamlessly inspire a performance from some of the world's best figure skaters, perfectly choreographed to complement her hits."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://anastacia.com/news/0-6/anastacia-art-on-ice |title=Official Website : News |publisher=Anastacia |accessdate=March 7, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100304120649/http://www.anastacia.com/news/0-6/anastacia-art-on-ice |archivedate=March 4, 2010 }}</ref> During the summer of 2010 Anastacia also became one of the main judges on British talent series ''[[Don't Stop Believing (TV series)|Don't Stop Believing]]'', a contest inspired by the musical comedy-drama ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dontstopbelieving.five.tv/team |title=Home | Channel 5 |publisher=Dontstopbelieving.five.tv |accessdate=March 25, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100716185916/http://dontstopbelieving.five.tv/team |archivedate=July 16, 2010 }}</ref><ref>[http://anastacia.com/news/0-6/all-star-line-up-joins-dont-stop-believing/0-6] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718140909/http://anastacia.com/news/0-6/all-star-line-up-joins-dont-stop-believing/0-6|date=July 18, 2010}}</ref> During promotion for the reality show the singer noted that she had left Mercury Records and was currently with no label. Following "Stalemate", Anastacia released "Safety", a duet with Russian singer [[Dima Bilan]], was recorded in Los Angeles in May 2010. The song was performed live for the first time at the [[Muz-TV]] Music Awards Moscow in June 2010. The song was released as a single in [[Russia]] in August 2010. On August 13, Anastacia announced that she would be join Belgian singer [[Natalia (Belgian singer)|Natalia Druyts]] for a joint tour, Natalia Meets Anastacia, for six arena shows which were performed at the Sportpaleis, Belgium. On August 17, Natalia and Anastacia recorded a collaborative single, "[[Burning Star (song)|Burning Star]]", which was released on September 17, 2010 as promotion for the concert series.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://anastacia.com/news/0-6/natalia-meets-anastacia/0-6 |deadurl=yes |title=News |website=Anastacia |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718140900/http://www.anastacia.com/news/0-6/natalia-meets-anastacia/0-6 |archivedate=July 18, 2010 |accessdate=July 14, 2010}}</ref> On November 13, Anastacia became the first international singer ever to perform a concert in Northern Cyprus which is occupied by Turkish forces.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ntvmsnbc.com/id/25151276/ |title=KKTC'de tarihi konser – Kıbrıs |publisher=ntvmsnbc.com |accessdate=March 25, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ntvmsnbc.com/id/25150741/ |title=Rum lobisini dinlemedi – Kıbrıs |publisher=ntvmsnbc.com |accessdate=March 25, 2012}}</ref> In February 2011, Anastacia was a guest at the [[Gigi D'Alessio]] concert at [[Radio City Music Hall]] in New York, performing as an opening act. On November 11, 2011 she performed in Madrid for the SAP Sapphire Conference.
In June 2012, Anastacia was confirmed as a guest judge for the ninth series of [[The X Factor (UK)|''The X Factor UK'']] at the [[Glasgow]] auditions alongside judges [[Louis Walsh]], [[Gary Barlow]] and [[Tulisa Contostavlos]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.breakingnews.ie/entertainment/anastacia-set-for-guest-x-factor-slot-554510.html|title=Anastacia set for guest 'X Factor' slot|publisher=BreakingNews.ie|accessdate=June 7, 2012}}</ref> Her appearance on the show was heavily praised with sources stating that she had "great chemistry" with the others and had greatly impressed the producers, causing speculation that the singer would become the new fourth judge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/news/the-x-factor/356766-the-x-factor-anastacia-nicole-scherzinger-gary-tulisa?s_cid=424html |title=Anastacia Impresses At X Factor Auditions In Glasgow | MTV UK |publisher=Mtv.co.uk |date=2014-04-22 |accessdate=2014-06-06}}</ref> However it was later revealed that the singer was forced to reject the judging offer due to contractual agreements regarding the Night of the Proms European winter tour as well of the release of her independent cover album.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/anastacia-reveals-she-turned-down-x-factor-judge-offer-7945710.html |title=Anastacia reveals she turned down X Factor judge offer – Showbiz|work=London Evening Standard|date=2012-07-16|accessdate=2014-06-06}}</ref>
During the summer of 2012, Anastacia toured throughout Europe.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.anastacia.com/events |deadurl=yes |title=Tour |website=Anastacia |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120606082810/http://www.anastacia.com/events |archivedate=June 6, 2012 |accessdate=June 10, 2012}}</ref>
In July 2012, Anastacia announced on her Twitter page<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/AnastaciaFanily/statuses/221754319798673408 |title=Twitter / AnastaciaFanily: Single released will B w/the |publisher=Twitter.com |date=July 7, 2012 |accessdate=February 21, 2013}}</ref> (and Facebook fan page<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/Anastacia |title=Anastacia |publisher=Facebook |date= |accessdate=February 21, 2013}}</ref>) the release of a new commercial single for car company [[Škoda Auto]]. She performed the song "What Can We Do (Deeper Love)" for the first time on July 10 in the Jazz Festival in Montreaux, Switzerland. She later released the video for the song through her social media pages.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=320824834676651 |title=Anastacia – What Can We Do (A Deeper Love) |publisher=Facebook |date= |accessdate=February 21, 2013}}</ref>
On September 17, it was announced that the singer had signed with the "BMG Masters Model" service of [[BMG Rights Management]], along with the service's primary German-based distributing partner, [[Rough Trade Distribution]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Ingham|first=Tim|title=Anastacia signs to BMG masters model|url=http://www.musicweek.com/news/read/anastacia-signs-to-bmg-masters-model/051822|publisher=[[Music Week]]}}</ref> Global distribution is expected to be achieved via a range of partnering labels and distribution services. The deal included the release of her following two albums, ''[[It's a Man's World (Anastacia album)|It's a Man's World]]'', a collection of covers of songs by male rock artists released on November 9, 2012, followed by an album of original material.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bmg.com/category/news/?n=ger-anastacia-chooses-bmg-to-release-next-two-albums |title=News | BMG Music Rights Management |publisher=Bmg.com |date= |accessdate=February 21, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130127024339/http://www.bmg.com/category/news/?n=ger-anastacia-chooses-bmg-to-release-next-two-albums |archivedate=January 27, 2013 }}</ref>
Throughout November and December 2012 Anastacia took part in the annual Night of the Proms, a series of concerts held in Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany which combine classical music with famous pop songs. On February 2, 2013, Anastacia [[Twitter|tweeted]] that she would start writing for her next studio album of new material in the following week.<ref>{{cite tweet|user=AnastaciaMusic|author=Anastacia|number=297701788356841472|date=2 February 2013|title=Getting butterflies 4 the #IAMWtour. Also i'll srt the writing 4 the New album nextweek. Feeling blessed by the support of the Fanily&BMG}}</ref> [[File:Anastacia bei stars@ndr2 in Vechta (2).JPG|thumbnail|Anastacia performing in Germany (2014)]] On February 27, 2013, Anastacia announced that she was forced to cancel her European tour due to the fact that she was diagnosed with [[breast cancer]] for the second time and was undergoing treatment.<ref>{{cite news|last=Saad|first=Nardine|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/gossip/la-et-mg-anastacia-breast-cancer-cancels-tour-20130228,0,166202.story|title=Singer Anastacia cancels tour after 2nd breast cancer diagnosis|newspaper=[[The Los Angeles Times]]|date= February 28, 2013|accessdate=March 1, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1550459/anastacia-again-diagnosed-with-breast-cancer-cancels-shows|title=Anastacia Again Diagnosed With Breast Cancer, Cancels Shows|newspaper=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date= |accessdate=March 1, 2013}}</ref> On July 20, 2013, Anastacia was given the all-clear from breast cancer for a second time, tweeting "Cancer Free Forever". On October 1, 2013 Anastacia informed the media that she had undergone a double mastectomy.<ref name="ReferenceA"/> Due to her decade-long charitable efforts in breast cancer awareness, Anastacia became only the second woman to be presented with the Humanitarian Award at the ''[[GQ]]'' Men of the Year Awards in 2013.<ref name="ReferenceB"/> Anastacia later confirmed via her Twitter account that she was writing and recording songs for her sixth studio album, including working with producers John Fields and Steve Diamond. She also stated it would mark a return to her "sprock" sound.
===2014–2015: ''Resurrection'' and ''Ultimate Collection''=== The album, entitled ''[[Resurrection (Anastacia album)|Resurrection]]'', was released in May 2014 and was met with both critical and commercial success, giving the singer her sixth top ten Italian album and fifth top ten UK album. It also reached the top 5 of the Swiss and German charts and the top ten of the Dutch charts. Reviews were overwhelmingly positive, acknowledging a return to form from the singer as well as a creative resurgence. The lead single "Stupid Little Things" was released on April 4. Although only moderately successful, reaching the top ten in Belgium and top 20 in Italy it was quickly met with a positive reaction from music critics, with MTV's Brad Stern naming it one of the "5 Anastacia's ''[[The Ultimate Collection (Anastacia album)|Ultimate Collection]]'' was released in November and peaked in the top ten of the UK charts, giving the singer her 6th top ten album in Britain. During the same month Anastacia attended The Children For Peace Gala at Spazio Novecento in Rome where she received the special artist award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.it/onstage/15/12/02/the-children-for-peace-dinner-gala-roma-anastacia-vip-foto|title=The Children For Peace e Anastacia per i bambini|website=VanityFair.it}}</ref> As of 2016, she has sold over 52 million albums worldwide.
===2016–present: ''Strictly Come Dancing'' and ''Evolution''=== In August 2016, Anastacia became a contestant on the [[Strictly Come Dancing (series 14)|fourteenth series]] of the British television dance contest ''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]'', broadcast [[BBC One]]. Partnered with dancer [[Brendan Cole]], the couple were voted in the bottom two to complete in the dance-off in the show's second week. A doctor ruled that Anastacia was unable to compete because of an injury sustained during the previous day's performance, and instead the result was decided by selecting the competitor with the higher number of audience votes. The decision was controversial, resulting in a number of complaints, and one judge is said to have threatened to quit over it. She was eliminated from the show in its sixth week.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/strictly-come-dancing-2016-bruno-tonioli-threatened-to-quit-after-anastasia-dance-off-controversy-a7347551.html|title=Strictly Come Dancing 2016: Bruno Tonioli 'threatened to quit' after Anastasia [sic] controversy|author=Jack Shepherd|website=The Independent|date=6 Oct 2016|access-date=7 Oct 2016}}</ref>
In June 2017, she supported [[Lionel Richie]] in some of the UK dates of his [[All the Hits Tour (Lionel Richie and Mariah Carey)|All The Hits Tour]]. The following July, she released a new single, "[[Caught in the Middle (Anastacia song)|Caught in the Middle]]" which preceded her seventh studio album ''[[Evolution (Anastacia album)|Evolution]]'', released in September 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.theguardian.com/music/2017/sep/14/anastacia-evolution-review-melodic-warm-pop-rock-alternative|title=Anastacia: Evolution review – melodic, warm pop-rock alternative|last=Aroesti|first=Rachel|date=2017-09-14|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-07-31}}</ref> After the success of her album, she embarked on her Evolution Tour to promote the record.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.anastaciafanily.com/tour/evolution-tour/|title=Evolution Tour 2018 - Official Anastacia Fanclub|last=www.wearecreativo.com|work=Official Anastacia Fanclub|access-date=2018-07-31|language=en-US}}</ref> In 2018, she appeared on ''Ballando con le stelle'', the Italian version of ''Dancing with the Stars'', in a special one-off performance.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.who.com.au/anastacia-popstar-what-she-looks-like-now|title=What singer Anastacia looks like now|access-date=2018-07-22}}</ref>
== Other ventures ==
===Fashion===
"[[S.Oliver|Anastacia by s. Oliver]]" is a clothing collection released in late 2006 by Anastacia and German clothing company s. Oliver.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.anastaciabysoliver.com/ |title=anastaciabysoliver.com |publisher=anastaciabysoliver.com |date= |accessdate=February 21, 2013}}</ref> A limited edition CD named ''Welcome to My Style'' was also available for free to customers who spent sixty euros or more on the clothes in November. Anastacia by s. Oliver also released a limited edition clothing line called Limited Luxury, which was designed together with [[Swarovski]]. The clothing line hit the stores on November 2, 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.anastaciabysoliver.com/index.php?radLang=de&radContentId=r3_16652079954693a4e1e1e4e0 |title=Limited Luxury |publisher=Anastaciabysoliver.com |accessdate=September 26, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080214044445/http://www.anastaciabysoliver.com/index.php?radLang=de&radContentId=r3_16652079954693a4e1e1e4e0 |archive-date=February 14, 2008 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref> In 2015, Anastacia announced her collaboration with jewelry brand ''Tat2 Designs,'' saying "I'm super excited to announce ''The Resurrection Collection–Anastacia by Tat2''." The jewelry line consists of bracelets, earrings and necklaces by Anastacia and designer Briana Erin.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.anastaciafanclub.com.pt/news1540|title=Anastacia's jewerly line now available|last=COFAPT|access-date=2018-07-31|language=en-US}}</ref>
==Philanthropy== During her years of success, Anastacia has supported many charity events such as [[Life Ball]] 2006 (Europe's largest annual AIDS charity event), Make a Difference and Challenge for the Children. Anastacia was one of the fifteen artists to record their take on a Disney song on the CD [[Disneymania]]. Anastacia recorded "Someday My Prince Will Come" from ''[[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937 film)|Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]]''. It is also included on the Collector's Edition of her second album.
In 2003, Anastacia took part in the charity event, [[46664 (concerts)|46664]], organized by [[Nelson Mandela]] to raise awareness of AIDS. She sang with [[U2]] and [[Queen (band)|Queen]], and also contributed to the song "Amandla", recording the song and providing some of the lyrics.
[[Annie Lennox]] joined forces with Anastacia and 22 other female artists to raise awareness of the transmission of HIV to unborn children in Africa.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.annielennoxsing.com |title=: Sing: |publisher=Annielennoxsing.com |accessdate=September 26, 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090914212912/http://www.annielennoxsing.com/| archivedate=September 14, 2009 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> The single "Sing" was released on [[World AIDS Day]], December 1, 2007, in conjunction with Annie Lennox's appearance at the Nelson Mandela 46664 concert in South Africa.
After being diagnosed with cancer, Anastacia created "The Anastacia Fund" in partnership with [[Estée Lauder Companies|Estée Lauder]]. The organization helps raise awareness about breast cancer and the importance of mammograms to women 35 and under. Anastacia began selling her stage clothing on [[eBay]], donating a portion to [[The Breast Cancer Research Foundation]]. The auctions were hosted by an eBay Trading Assistant and Certified Business Consultant. New listings began every Friday for 6 months.
In 2008, she performed at the "Pink Ribbon Gala" in [[Stockholm]], she appeared on "Divas II", a benefit concert along with many other female artists as well as performing at the [[ChildLine Concert]] in Dublin.
==Personal life== Over the course of her life Anastacia has battled numerous health problems including being diagnosed with [[Crohn's disease]] at age 13, [[breast cancer]] at age 34, and the heart condition [[supraventricular tachycardia]], which the singer discovered she had at age 39. In February 2013, it was announced that Anastacia was battling a more intense form of breast cancer. On July 20 the singer announced via Twitter that she was again cancer free, while on October 1, 2013 to coincide with Breast Cancer Awareness Month, Anastacia informed the media that she had undergone a double mastectomy.<ref name="ReferenceA"/> In recognition of her decade-long charitable efforts in breast cancer awareness, Anastacia became only the second woman to be presented with the Humanitarian Award at the ''[[GQ]]'' Men of the Year Awards in 2013.<ref name="ReferenceB"/>
Anastacia married her [[bodyguard]] Wayne Newton in [[Huatulco]], Mexico on April 21, 2007. She became a step-mother to his two children from a previous relationship.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/showbiz/news/a217439/anastacia-to-divorce-bodyguard/|title=Anastacia to divorce bodyguard?|date=2010-04-30|work=Digital Spy|access-date=2018-07-22|language=en}}</ref> In April 2010, it was confirmed that the two had filed a petition for divorce.<ref>{{cite news|title=EXCLUSIVE: Singer Anastacia Files For Divorce|url=http://radaronline.com/exclusives/2010/04/exclusive-singer-anastacia-files-divorce/|accessdate=22 August 2013|newspaper=Radar Online|date=Apr 28, 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100502022547/http://www.radaronline.com/exclusives/2010/04/exclusive-singer-anastacia-files-divorce|archivedate=May 2, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Davies|first=Rebecca|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a217439/anastacia-to-divorce-bodyguard.html|title=Anastacia to divorce bodyguard?|newspaper=Digital Spy|date=April 30, 2010|accessdate=April 30, 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503140305/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a217439/anastacia-to-divorce-bodyguard.html|archivedate=May 3, 2010}}</ref>
Anastacia has several [[tattoo]]s on her back, and one below her neck saying "Forever" in an unusual font. In 2008 she added wings to this tattoo.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.funtrivia.com/en/Music/Anastacia-10071.html |title=Anastacia |publisher=FunTrivia.com |accessdate=September 26, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090415063924/http://www.funtrivia.com/en/Music/Anastacia-10071.html |archive-date=April 15, 2009 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref> She also has an [[Ankh]] on her lower back, which appeared on her first album. Since it represents eternal life, to her fans it has come to symbolize her.<ref name="Times 2005"/> Her third tattoo is at the base of her neck just above 'Forever' and is her only coloured tattoo. It says A&W to symbolise her marriage to Wayne Newton. Although the pair are now divorced Anastacia has said she does not regret the tattoo.
Anastacia lived in Los Angeles, California, but moved to Florida in 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.anastaciafanily.com/anastacia-arrived-in-malta-interview-for-signal107/|title=Anastacia arrived in Malta today for her next show!|last=www.wearecreativo.com|date=2018-06-04|work=Official Anastacia Fanclub|access-date=2018-07-22|language=en-US}}</ref>

{{Infobox murderer | name = Andrew Kehoe | image = AndrewKehoe.jpg | image_size = | caption = Photo taken c. 1920 | birth_name = Andrew Phillip Kehoe | occupation = [[Farmer]], school board member, [[treasurer]] | birth_date = {{Birth date|1872|02|01}} | birth_place = [[Tecumseh, Michigan]], U.S. | death_date = {{Death date and age|1927|05|18|1872|02|01}} | death_place = [[Bath Township, Michigan]], U.S. | cause = Suicide (explosives) | spouse = {{marriage|Ellen Agnes "Nellie" Price|1912|1927|reason=murdered}} | date = May 18, 1927 | time = | targets = [[Bath Consolidated School]] | locations = [[Bath Township, Michigan]] | fatalities = 44 | injuries = 58 | weapons = Explosives ([[dynamite]], [[Incendiary device|firebombs]], [[pyrotol]]) }}
'''Andrew Philip Kehoe''' (February 1, 1872 – May 18, 1927) was an [[Americans|American]] farmer and treasurer of his township [[school board]], notable as a [[mass murderer]] for killing his wife and 43 other people (including 38 children), and injuring 58 people by setting off bombs in the [[Bath School disaster]] on May 18, 1927. He committed [[suicide]] near the school by detonating [[dynamite]] in his truck, causing an explosion which killed several other people and wounded more. He had earlier set off [[incendiary device]]s in his house and farm, destroying all the buildings, as well as killing two horses and other animals.
== Early life and education== Kehoe was born in [[Tecumseh, Michigan]], among the younger of a family of 13 children. His parents were Philip Kehoe (1833–1915) and Mary (McGovern) Kehoe (1835–1890).<ref>{{cite web|last1=Daggy|first1=J.L.|title=The Bath School Disaster: Andrew Philip Kehoe - Farmer, School Board Treasurer, Bomber|url=http://daggy.name/tbsd/bsdlrp13.htm|website=Daggy.Com|accessdate=May 14, 2016}}</ref> He attended [[Tecumseh High School (Michigan)|Tecumseh High School]] and Michigan State College (later [[Michigan State University]]), where he studied [[electrical engineering]]. There, he first met his future wife, Ellen "Nellie" Price, the daughter of a wealthy [[Lansing, Michigan|Lansing]] family.<ref name="Parker1980">{{cite book|author=Grant Parker|title=Mayday: History of a Village Holocaust|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=osbhAAAAMAAJ|page = 27| accessdate=December 17, 2012|year=1980|publisher=Parker Press}}</ref>
After college, Kehoe went south west, apparently working for several years as an electrician in [[St. Louis, Missouri]]. During this period, in 1911, he suffered a severe head injury in a fall<ref name="Mayo2008">{{cite book|author=Mike Mayo|title=American Murder: Criminals, Crime, and the Media|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EEoU2kOb0OIC&pg=PA175| page=175|accessdate=December 17, 2012|date=February 1, 2008|publisher=Visible Ink Press|isbn=978-1-57859-191-6}}</ref> which resulted in his being in a coma for two weeks.<ref>{{cite web|title=Interview with Arnie Bernstein|url=https://www.press.umich.edu/pdf/9780472116065_qa.pdf|publisher=[[University of Michigan Press]]|accessdate=August 4, 2017|date=2009|quote=...an accident that put him in a coma for two weeks}}</ref>
Kehoe then moved back in with his father after the injury. He had been away from the family home for several years. During that time and after his mother's death his father married Frances Wilder. On September 17, 1911, Frances was severely burned when the family's stove exploded as she was attempting to light it. The fuel soaked her, with her body catching fire. Kehoe threw water from a nearby bucket on her; due to the oil-based nature of the fire, the water did nothing to put the flames out. Frances later died from her injuries with allegations being made that the stove had been tampered with.<ref name="Bernstein2009">{{cite book|author=Arnie Bernstein|year=2009|title=Bath Massacre: America's First School Bombing|chapter = Chapter Two - Andrew P. Kehoe|publisher=The University of Michigan Press|isbn=978-0-472-11606-5}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Frances Kehoe Death Certificate|url=http://seekingmichigan.contentdm.oclc.org/cdm/singleitem/collection/p129401coll7/id/378196/rec/88|website=Seeking Michigan|publisher=Michigan History Foundation|accessdate=May 31, 2017|date=September 19, 1911}}</ref>{{efn|Monty Ellsworth's version of these events in ''The Bath School Disaster'' incorrectly differs on one detail - he says that the fire happened when Kehoe was 14 but agrees with other sources on points of fact. He does mention the rumors that the stove was tampered with.<ref name="Ellsworth1927_3">{{cite book|author=Monty J. Ellsworth|title=The Bath School Disaster|chapter = Chapter Three — Life of Andrew Kehoe|url=http://daggy.name/tbsd/tbsd-t.htm#ChapterThree|accessdate=December 17, 2012|year=1927}}</ref>}}
==Marriage and family== After his return to Michigan, in 1912 he married Nellie Price. In 1919 the couple bought a {{convert|185|acre|m2|adj=on}} farm outside the village of [[Bath Township, Michigan|Bath]]<ref name="ellsworth ch 1">{{cite web|url=http://daggy.name/tbsd/tbsd-t.htm#ChapterOne|title=Chapter One—The Bath Consolidated School|work= The Bath School Disaster|author=Ellsworth, Monty J.|year=1927|publisher=Bath School Museum Committee (1991 ed.)|format=online version|oclc=6743232|accessdate=April 13, 2011}}</ref><ref name="mayday p 27">{{cite book|author=Parker, Grant|year=1992|title=Mayday, History of a Village Holocaust|page=27|publisher=Liberty Press|isbn=0-9604958-0-0}}</ref> from Nellie's aunt for $12,000. He paid $6,000 in cash and took out a $6,000 [[Mortgage loan|mortgage]].<ref name="Parker1980"/>
== Personality == Kehoe was regarded by his neighbors as a highly intelligent man who grew impatient and angry with those who disagreed with him. Neighbors recalled that Kehoe was always neat, dressed meticulously, and was known to change his shirt at midday or whenever it became even slightly dirty. Neighbors also recounted how Kehoe was cruel to his farm animals, having once beaten a horse to death.<ref name="Ellsworth1927_3">{{cite book|author=Monty J. Ellsworth|title=The Bath School Disaster|chapter = Chapter Three — Life of Andrew Kehoe|url=http://daggy.name/tbsd/tbsd-t.htm#ChapterThree|accessdate=December 17, 2012|year=1927}}</ref> The Kehoes initially attended services at the [[Catholic]] church in Bath, but he refused to pay the church's parish assessment of members and prevented his wife from attending.<ref name="Ellsworth1927_3"/>
Kehoe's neighbors thought he preferred mechanical tinkering to farming. His neighbor M. J. "Monty" Ellsworth wrote in his account of the disaster,
{{quote|He never farmed it as other farmers do and he tried to do everything with his tractor. He was in the height of his glory when fixing machinery or tinkering. He was always trying new methods in his work, for instance, hitching two mowers behind his tractor. This method did not work at different times and he would just leave the hay standing. He also put four sections of drag and two rollers at once behind his tractor. He spent so much time tinkering that he didn't prosper.<ref name="Ellsworth1927_3"/>}}
== Bath Consolidated School administration == With a reputation for thrift, Kehoe was elected [[treasurer]] of the Bath Consolidated School board in 1924. While on the board, Kehoe fought for lower taxes and was often at cross purposes with other board members, voting against them and calling for adjournment when he did not get his way. He repeatedly accused superintendent Emory Huyck of financial mismanagement.<ref name="Ellsworth1927_3"/>
While on the school board, Kehoe was appointed as the Bath Township Clerk in 1925 for a short period. In the spring 1926 election, he was defeated for the position, and was angered by his public defeat. His neighbor Ellsworth thought Kehoe started planning his "murderous revenge" against the community at that time. Another neighbor, A. McMullen, noticed that Kehoe stopped working altogether on his farm in his last year, and thought he might be planning [[suicide]].<ref name="Ellsworth1927_3"/>
During these years, Nellie Kehoe was chronically ill with [[tuberculosis]], and had frequent hospital stays - at the time there was no effective treatment or cure for the disease. By the time of the Bath School disaster, Kehoe had ceased making mortgage and [[homeowner's insurance]] payments. The mortgage lender had begun [[foreclosure]] proceedings against the farm.<ref name="Ellsworth1927_3"/><ref name="dynamiter">{{cite web|title=School Dynamiter First Slew Wife|url=http://freepages.history.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~bauerle/nyt520.txt|publisher=New York Times (via Bauerle FreePages @ RootsWeb.com)|accessdate=January 15, 2013|date=May 20, 1927|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141018142228/http://freepages.history.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~bauerle/nyt520.txt|archive-date=2014-10-18|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref><ref name="ellsworth ch 3">{{cite web|url=http://daggy.name/tbsd/tbsd-t.htm#ChapterThree|title=Chapter Three—Life of Andrew Kehoe|work= The Bath School Disaster|author=Ellsworth, Monty J.|year=1927|publisher=Bath School Museum Committee (1991 ed.)|format=online version}}</ref>
== Bath School disaster == {{Main|Bath School disaster}}
The Bath School disaster is the name given to a series of explosions perpetrated by Kehoe on May 18, 1927, in Bath Township, Michigan, which killed 45 people ([[murder-suicide|including Kehoe himself]]) and injured at least 58. Most of the victims were children in the second to sixth grades (7–12 years of age) attending the Bath Consolidated School. Their deaths constitute the deadliest act of [[mass murder]] in a school in U.S. history.
Between May 16, when he returned home from a hospital stay, and the morning of May 18, Kehoe killed his wife. He moved her body to a farm building before setting off incendiary explosions in their house and farm buildings. About the same time, he had arranged timed explosions in the new school building. The materials in the north wing exploded as planned, killing many students and some adults inside. Kehoe had set a timed detonator to ignite [[dynamite]] and hundreds of pounds of [[pyrotol]] at the school, which he had secretly bought and planted in the basement of both wings over the course of many months. The second {{convert|500|lb}} of explosives in the south wing did not detonate, so that part of the school was not destroyed.
As rescuers started gathering at the school, Kehoe drove up and stopped his truck. During a struggle with Superintendent Huyck, Kehoe detonated dynamite stored inside his [[Shrapnel shell|shrapnel]]-filled truck, killing himself and Huyck, as well as killing and injuring several others (among them a boy who had survived the initial bombing).<ref name = "Burcar">{{cite book|last=Burcar|first=Colleen|title=It Happened in Michigan: Remarkable Events That Shaped History|year=2011|publisher=Globe Pequot|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=3xcjTa3sRisC&pg=PA87&#v=onepage&q&f=false|accessdate=January 15, 2013}}</ref> During the rescue efforts, searchers discovered the additional {{convert|500|lb}} of unexploded dynamite and pyrotol planted throughout the basement of the school's south wing. These explosives, connected to an alarm clock that was supposed to act as the detonator, had been set for the same time as the other explosion.
[[File:Keyhoe sign.jpg|thumb|Sign on Andrew Kehoe's fence]] After the bombings, investigators found a wooden sign wired to the farm's fence with Kehoe's last message, "Criminals are made, not born", stenciled on it.<ref name="dynamiter"/> When investigators were done taking an inventory of the Kehoes' estate, they estimated that, prior to its destruction, sale of the unused equipment and materials on the farm would have yielded enough money to pay off the Kehoes' mortgage.
One of Kehoe's sisters claimed his remains and arranged for burial without ceremony in an unmarked grave at Mount Rest Cemetery in [[St. Johns, Michigan]].<ref name="daggy p 13">{{cite web|url=http://daggy.name/tbsd/bsdlrp13.htm|author=Daggy, J.L.|title=Andrew Philip Kehoe, Farmer, School Board Treasurer, Bomber|publisher=Daggy Space Website}}</ref> The Price family claimed Nellie's remains and had her body buried in Lansing, under her maiden name.<ref name="daggy p 37">{{cite web|url=http://daggy.name/tbsd/bsdlrp37.htm|title=Ellen Agnes Price Kehoe Murder Victim; wife of School Bomber|author=Daggy, J.L.|publisher=Daggy Space Website}}</ref>
