'''Anthony Edward Sowell''' (born August 19, 1959) is an American [[serial killer]] known as the '''Cleveland Strangler'''. He was arrested in October 2009 after the bodies of eleven women were discovered by police investigators at his [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], [[duplex (building)|duplex]] at 12205 Imperial Avenue in Mount Pleasant neighborhood.<ref name="bodies">{{cite news| work=BBC News | url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/8335859.stm|title=Six bodies at US rapist's house |date=October 31, 2009 | accessdate=November 1, 2009}}</ref>
==Early life== Anthony Edward Sowell was raised in [[East Cleveland, Ohio|East Cleveland]], one of seven children born to [[single parent|single mother]] Claudia "Gertude" Garrison. Seven other children belonging to Sowell's sister also lived in the household, having moved in after the death of their chronically ill mother. According to Sowell's [[niece]], Garrison subjected the siblings to [[physical abuse]] while her own children watched from adjacent rooms. In one incident, Garrison forced her to strip naked in front of the other children, then whipped her with electrical cords until she bled. Sowell himself began raping his niece on an almost daily basis for two years, starting when she was eleven.<ref>[http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/08/serial_killer_anthony_sowell_began_raping_niece_when_both_were_children_witness_testifies.html Serial killer Anthony Sowell began raping niece when both were children, witness testifies], Cleveland ''Plain-Dealer'', 2 August 2011</ref>
==Military service== At the age of 18, Sowell entered the [[United States Marine Corps]] on January 24, 1978. He attended recruit training at [[Marine Corps Recruit Depot Parris Island]] in [[South Carolina]], then was further trained as an [[electrician]] at [[Marine Corps Base Camp Lejeune|Camp Lejeune]] in [[North Carolina]]. On July 13, 1978, he was assigned to the [[2nd Marine Aircraft Wing]] at [[Marine Corps Air Station Cherry Point]], also in North Carolina. In 1980, Sowell spent a year overseas with the [[3rd Marine Logistics Group|3rd Force Service Support Group]], then returned to Cherry Point. He was then ordered to [[Marine Corps Base Camp Butler]] in [[Okinawa Prefecture|Okinawa]], [[Japan]] on January 20, 1984. A year later, he transferred to [[Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton|Camp Pendleton]] in [[California]] for three days until his discharge on January 18, 1985. During his seven-year Marine Corps career, Corporal Sowell received a [[Good Conduct Medal (United States)|Good Conduct Medal]] with one [[service star]], a [[Sea Service Ribbon|Sea Service Deployment Ribbon]], a Certificate of Commendation, a [[Mast (naval)|Meritorious Mast]], and two Letters of Appreciation.<ref name="marine">{{cite news|url=http://www.enctoday.com/news/serial-6305-havelock-killer-sowell.html |title=Marine Corps says accused serial killer stationed twice at Cherry Point and once at Camp Lejeune |work=[[Havelock, North Carolina|Havelock]] News |date=November 5, 2009 |accessdate=2009-11-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091109105933/http://www.enctoday.com/news/serial-6305-havelock-killer-sowell.html |archivedate=November 9, 2009 |df= }}</ref>
== 1989 attack, incarceration, and release == In 1989, Melvette Sockwell, who was three months pregnant, went to Sowell's home voluntarily. When she tried to leave, he bound her hands and feet with a tie and belt, then gagged her with a rag. The victim told police: "He choked me real hard because my body started tingling. I thought I was going to die."<ref name="skull"/> Sowell was charged with kidnapping, rape and attempted rape. He eventually pleaded guilty to the charge of attempted rape, and as a result he served 15 years in prison. He was released in 2005.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2009/11/anthony_sowell_was_considered.html|title=Anthony Sowell was considered unlikely to attack again in 2005 evaluation|date=2009-11-05|work=CBS News|accessdate=2009-11-05}}</ref>
Sowell worked in a factory until 2007 when he began collecting unemployment benefits.<ref name="skull"/> Neighbors said he earned a living selling scrap metal.<ref name="bodies"/> They complained to the health department of a foul smell in the neighborhood.<ref name="skull"/> He was a member of an online dating service, where he stated that he was a "master" looking for a submissive person to "train".<ref name="evenMoreBodies">{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2009/11/02/crimesider/entry5495923.shtml|title=Anthony Sowell Cruised Sex Fetish Site While Dead Bodies Rotted in His Cleveland Home|date=November 4, 2009|work=CBS News|accessdate=November 4, 2009 | first=Edecio | last=Martinez}}</ref>
Lori Frazier, a niece of Cleveland Mayor [[Frank G. Jackson]], began a relationship with Sowell shortly after his release from prison and resided in his home. She claims to have smelled the stench of decaying bodies and that she was told the smell was coming from Sowell's stepmother. When she moved out, she claimed that the smell was from Ray's Sausage Shop, located next door to the Sowell residence. There is some confusion about when Frazier stopped living in Sowell's home. In a video interview she mentions moving out in 2007, but in a published article she is said to have been living there until 2008.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2009/11/11/crimesider/entry5616478.shtml | work=CBS News | title=Mayor's Niece Lived With Alleged "Cleveland Strangler" Anthony Sowell and Rotting Bodies | first=Ryan | last=Smith | date=November 12, 2009}}</ref> Another article quotes a friend of Frazier's stating that Frazier stopped spending time at Sowell's home in 2008.<ref>Morris, Phillip. [http://www.cleveland.com/morris/index.ssf/2009/11/why_didnt_the_serial_killer_ki.html "Why didn't the serial killer kill her, she wonders?"], ''Cleveland.com'', 24 November 2009.</ref>
==Discovery of bodies and arrest== In September 2009,<ref name="marine"/> Sowell invited Latundra Billups to his home for a drink. On September 22, 2009, she reported to police that after a few drinks, he became angry, hit her, choked her and raped her as she passed out. On October 29, police arrived at his home with a warrant to arrest him for the alleged rape. He was not there, but he was located and arrested two days later.<ref name="marine"/>
The bodies of two women were buried in a shallow grave in the basement and four other women were found on the 3rd floor of the home, in crawl spaces in the house.<ref name="moreBodies">{{cite news | url=http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2009/11/crews_again_digging_at_anthony.html | title=Police discover 10 victims at Anthony Sowell's home | date=November 3, 2009 | work=Cleveland Metro | accessdate=November 3, 2009}}</ref> After digging in the backyard, investigators found three more bodies and the remains of a fourth. Police also found a human skull in a bucket inside the house, which brought the body count to eleven. Most of the victims were killed by manual strangulation and others were gagged or had ligatures on their bodies when they were discovered.<ref name="skull"/> Sowell also had at least three more rape victims that he had actually let live. All three never reported the attacks, due to their prior drug history or other personal reasons. Many victims were led to his property with an invitation to smoke [[crack cocaine]] with him. He was a known drug user throughout his neighborhood.
At the time of his arrest, Sowell was 50 years old. He had been living at that location for four years.<ref name="skull">{{cite news | url = http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/article6903700.ece | date = November 5, 2009 | title = Skull in a basket as police search Anthony Sowell's home for more bodies | work = The Times | accessdate = November 5, 2009 | location=London | first=James | last=Boneand}}</ref> He was held ==Conviction, sentencing, and appeals== Sowell was charged with eleven counts of [[aggravated murder]] and 74 counts of [[rape]], [[kidnapping]], [[tampering with evidence]], and [[abuse of a corpse]]. He pleaded [[not guilty by reason of insanity]] but later changed his plea to simply "not guilty."<ref>{{cite news | work=CNN | url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,571519,00.html | title='House of horrors' suspect due in court | date=March 24, 2010 | accessdate=March 24, 2010}}</ref> On July 22, 2011, he was convicted on all but two counts against him, including the murders of the eleven women whose bodies were found in his house in 2009. On August 10, jurors recommended the [[death penalty]] for Sowell.<ref>{{cite web | last = Scott | first = Michael | title =Cleveland serial killer Anthony Sowell's sentence: jury recommends death |work = The Plain Dealer | publisher = cleveland.com | date = 10 August 2011 | url = http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/08/cleveland_serial_killer_anthony_sowells_sentence.html | accessdate = }}</ref> On August 12, Judge [[Dick Ambrose]] upheld the jury's recommendation.<ref>{{cite web | title =Anthony Sowell to die for murders of 11 women; judge accepts jury's advice |work = cleveland.com | publisher = | date = 12 August 2011 | url = http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/2011/08/cleveland_judge_sowell.html |accessdate=December 11, 2016}}</ref> Since September 14, 2011, Sowell has resided on death row at [[Chillicothe Correctional Institution]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Ohio Department of Rehabilitation and Correction Offender Search Detail |publisher=Ohio Department of Rehabilitation and Correction |url=https://appgateway.drc.ohio.gov/OffenderSearch/Search/Details/A604609?Enc=%7Csowell%7Canthony%7C%7C%7C%7CAll%7C%7CName%7C1%7C10%7C |accessdate=July 26, 2017}}</ref>
In November 2011, Sowell's lawyers, Jeffry F. Kelleher and Thomas Rein, filed a Notice of Appeal with the [[Supreme Court of Ohio]]. Sowell's execution was set for October 29, 2012, but in March 2012, a Motion for Stay of Execution was filed; the motion was granted in April, pending final disposition of the appeal.<ref>{{cite web |title=Case No. 2011-1921 Entry |publisher=Supreme Court of Ohio |date=April 2, 2012|url=http://supremecourt.ohio.gov/pdf_viewer/pdf_viewer.aspx?pdf=191130.pdf |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> In October 2012, Sowell's new lawyers, Jeffrey M. Gamso and Erika Cunliffe of the Cuyahoga County Public Defender's office, appealed to have his conviction and death sentence overturned on 21 points,<ref>{{cite web |title=APPELLANT'S REPLY BRIEF AND ASSIGNMENTS OF ERROR |publisher=Supreme Court of Ohio |date=April 25, 2013 |url=http://www.sconet.state.oh.us/pdf_viewer/pdf_viewer.aspx?pdf=726248.pdf |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> with the main three being:
*that Sowell did not receive a fair trial because of the extensive media coverage. The "media attention was overwhelming, generating thousands of news stories, and…local coverage was 'both frenzied and sustained.'"<ref name=Krouse2013>{{cite web |title =Anthony Sowell's attorneys dispute prosecutors' claims that serial killer got fair trial |work=Northeast Ohio Media Group |publisher=cleveland.com |date = April 26, 2013 |author=Peter Krouse |url = http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/04/anthony_sowells_attorneys_refu.html |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> *that the courtroom had been closed to the public "during an evidentiary hearing and while a jury was picked"<ref name=Dissell>{{cite web |title=Ohio Supreme Court asks whether Anthony Sowell's right to a public trial was violated, attorneys respond |work=The Plain Dealer |publisher=cleveland.com |date=October 3, 2014 |author=Rachel Dissell |url=http://www.cleveland.com/court-justice/index.ssf/2014/10/ohio_supreme_court_asks_whethe.html#incart_river_index |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> *and that he had received "lousy legal representation."<ref>{{cite web |title=Serial killer Anthony Sowell was given a fair trial, Cuyahoga County prosecutors claim in court filing |work=Northeast Ohio Media Group |publisher=cleveland.com |date=March 12, 2013 |author=Peter Krouse |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/03/serial_killer_anthony_sowell_was_given.html |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> "Sowell's trial attorneys should have had their client plead guilty to killing the women and then focus their efforts on preventing Sowell from getting the death penalty."<ref name=Krouse2013 />
In September 2014, the court asked both parties to address three issues.<ref>{{cite web |title=Case No. 2011-1921 Entry |publisher=Supreme Court of Ohio |date=September 3, 2014 |url=http://supremecourt.ohio.gov/pdf_viewer/pdf_viewer.aspx?pdf=199920.pdf |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref>
On April 5, 2016, the Ohio Supreme Court heard arguments from Sowell's appellant attorneys and the Cuyahoga County D.A. representing the State of Ohio regarding the merits of the closed pre-trial Suppression Hearing prior to Sowell's trial, and the defendant's right to a fair and public trial. The attorneys representing Sowell argued that Sowell's [[Sixth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Sixth Amendment]] right was violated by closing the Suppression Hearing to the press, and that the Court should commute his Death Sentence to Life-In-Prison as a remedy to the structural error that resulted in the violation. They also argued that counsel had made errors, and "urged the Ohio Supreme Court to send the case back to Cuyahoga County for a retrial. 'Frankly we blew it,' attorney Jeffrey Gamso told the Ohio Supreme Court."<ref name=Borchardt>{{cite web |title=Anthony Sowell's lawyer asks Ohio Supreme Court to save his life |publisher=cleveland.com |date=April 5, 2016 |author=Jackie Borchardt |url=http://www.cleveland.com/open/index.ssf/2016/04/anthony_sowell.html |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref>
The State argued that if Sowell's Sixth Amendment right was violated via the closed pre-trial Suppression Hearing it would not have affected the outcome of the trial, as the evidence was overwhelming, and that "Sowell's attorneys were the ones who asked multiple times in his presence for the jury selection to be done privately, without cameras in the courtroom."<ref name=Dissell /> The State also asserted that Sowell has never denied his guilt, and that the heinous nature of his crimes—coupled with little mitigating evidence to deny imposing the death penalty—warrants affirming the death sentence.<ref name=Borchardt />
On December 8, 2016, the Ohio Supreme Court rejected an appeal from Anthony Sowell, affirming his aggravated murder convictions and death sentence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2016/12/ohio_supreme_court_upholds_con.html|title=Ohio Supreme Court upholds convictions of mass murderer Anthony Sowell|work=cleveland.com|date=December 8, 2016|accessdate=December 11, 2016}}</ref> In May 2017, Sowell appealed his case to the U.S. Supreme Court.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2017/05/anthony_sowell_appeals_case_to.html|title=Anthony Sowell appeals case to U.S. Supreme Court|work=cleveland.com|date=May 25, 2017|accessdate=June 1, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/anthony-sowell-notorious-cleveland-serial-killer-appeals-case-to-supreme-court/|title=Anthony Sowell, notorious Cleveland serial killer, appeals case to Supreme Court|work=CBS NEWS|date=May 23, 2017|accessdate=June 1, 2017}}</ref> In October 2017, the U.S. Supreme Court said that it would not review Sowell's appeal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/court-justice/index.ssf/2017/10/us_supreme_court_will_not_hear.html|title=U.S. Supreme Court will not hear Cleveland mass murderer Anthony Sowell's appeal|work=cleveland.com|date=October 2, 2017|accessdate=October 4, 2017}}</ref> In February 2018, the Ohio Supreme Court denied a request by Sowell to reopen his appeal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2018/02/ohio_supreme_court_wont_reopen.html|title=Ohio Supreme Court won't reopen Anthony Sowell appeal|work=cleveland.com|date=February 14, 2018|accessdate=February 19, 2018}}</ref>
==Victims== On November 5, 2009, two of the eleven victims were identified. The first to be identified was Tonia Carmichael, a 53-year-old [[African American]] woman who had disappeared more than a year earlier. Her body was found buried in his backyard. She appeared to have been strangled and was identified through the use of DNA evidence. Her mother had reported her missing in December 2008.<ref name="firstID">{{cite news | url= http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/2009/11/05/2009-11-05_police_id_first_of_11_victims_found_decomposing_in_anthony_sowells_cleveland_hom.html | title = Police ID first of 11 victims found decomposing in Anthony Sowell's Ohio home as Tonia Carmichael | date=November 5, 2009 | work=New York Daily News | accessdate=November 5, 2009 | first=Brian | last=Kates}}</ref>
The second victim was identified as Telacia Fortson, a 31-year-old African American woman who had disappeared five months earlier. Although she had been missing since June, her mother did not report her missing until she heard the news coverage regarding the dead bodies discovered in Sowell's home.<ref name="2ndVic">{{cite news | url = http://www.woio.com/Global/story.asp?S=11452010 | title = 2nd Victim: Cuyahoga County Coroner ID's Second Imperial Body | work = [[WIOO]] Action News | date = 5 November 2009 | accessdate = 2009-11-05 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20091108134441/http://www.woio.com/Global/story.asp?S=11452010# | archive-date = 2009-11-08 | dead-url = yes | df = }}</ref>
On November 8, 2009, three more bodies were identified. Crystal Dozier was a 38-year-old African American woman who went missing in May 2007. Dozier, the mother of seven children, lived in the area where her body was discovered. Her family reported her missing to the Cleveland Police Department. This was not the first time she had gone missing, and the family accused the police of failing to investigate. The family took it upon themselves to post fliers and call hospitals.<ref name="ThreeMore">{{Cite news | last = Baird | first = Gabriel | title = Names put to three more victims in Anthony Sowell case | newspaper = The Plain Dealer | location = Cleveland, Ohio | publisher = Cleveland Live | date = 8 November 2009 | url = http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2009/11/names_put_to_three_more_victim.html | accessdate = 2009-11-09}}</ref>
Amelda "Amy" Hunter was a 47-year-old African American woman. Hunter, a beautician and a mother of three, did not live in the area where her body was found, but she did visit frequently. A previous injury left her unable to use one of her arms. Her family did not report her missing until after police began removing bodies from Sowell's house.<ref name="ThreeMore"/>
Michelle Mason was a 45-year-old African American woman who was last seen in October 2008. She lived in the area where her body was found. According to records, the police conducted a full investigation when her family reported her missing.<ref name="ThreeMore"/>
Records of missing persons going back to Sowell's June 2005 release from prison were searched and [[DNA testing]] was conducted on the bodies found at Sowell's house. Protesters holding posters of missing loved ones gathered outside his home at the time.<ref name="bodies"/>
[[East Cleveland, Ohio|East Cleveland]] police also reopened several [[cold case (criminology)|cold case]]s from the late 1980s. The murders by strangulation used a similar [[modus operandi]] and had stopped around 1989, the same time that Sowell was arrested.<ref>[http://www.wkyc.com/news/local/news_article.aspx?storyid=124851&catid=45 "East Cleveland: Did suspected serial killer also strike in 1989?"], [[WKYC]]-TV, 7 November 2009.</ref> The [[FBI]] at the time was gathering information to see if Sowell may have been linked to unsolved cases in cities where he once lived.<ref name="ThreeMore"/><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/2009/11/09/2009-11-09_anthony_sowell_murder_case_goes_worldwide.html#ixzz0ctHtIHZ5 | location=New York | work=Daily News | title=Anthony Sowell rape and murder case goes international | first=Soraya | last=Roberts | date=9 November 2009}}</ref>

==Aftermath== After Sowell's conviction, in December 2011, Sowell's former residence at 12205 Imperial Avenue was demolished on the order of city leaders.<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2011/12/05/us/ohio-murder-house/index.html?hpt=hp_t3 Cleveland to demolish serial killer's home], CNN.com, 5 December 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.fox8.com/news/wjw-news-city-tearing-down-imperial-avenue-home,0,7063446.story Sowell's Imperial Avenue Home to be Demolished Tuesday] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111206124103/http://www.fox8.com/news/wjw-news-city-tearing-down-imperial-avenue-home%2C0%2C7063446.story |date=December 6, 2011 }}, WJW-TV, 5 December 2011</ref> Sowell resides on death row at [[Chillicothe Correctional Institution]].
==Media== ''House of Horrors: The Shocking True Story of Anthony Sowell, the Cleveland Strangler'', written by Cleveland-based journalist Robert Sberna, examines Sowell's crimes and profiles the 11 women he murdered and the six women who survived his attacks. The book was released in October 2012 by [[Kent State University Press]]. ''House of Horrors'' was named 2012 True Crime "Book of the Year" by ForeWord Reviews.<ref>[https://botya.forewordreviews.com/winners/2012/true-crime/ True Crime winners, 2012] at ForeWord Reviews</ref>
''Nobody's Women: The Crimes and Victims of Anthony Sowell, the Cleveland Serial Killer'' was written by Michigan-based crime author [[Steve Miller (author)|Steve Miller]]. The book details Sowell's murders and how he selected his victims. It was released in October 2012 by [[Penguin Publishing]].<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PZ-FtgAACAAJ |title=Nobody's Women: The Crimes and Victims of Anthony Sowell, the Cleveland Serial Killer |publisher=Google Books |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref>
The case was profiled on the series premiere of the [[Investigation Discovery]] show ''Killer Instinct''.<ref>[http://www.freep.com/story/entertainment/television/2015/08/17/chris-hansen-killer-instinct/31843037/ MSU grad Chris Hansen returns with 'Killer Instinct'] ''Detroit Free Press'', August 17, 2015</ref>
''Unseen'', a documentary film about the victims and survivors of Sowell, was produced by Laura Paglin and released in 2016. The film, which premiered at the Cleveland International Film Festival, is distributed by [[FilmRise]].{{cn|date=June 2018}}
== Letter controversy == In November 2012. Anthony Sowell released a letter through the website [[Serial Killers Ink]].<ref>{{cite news|first=Dick |last=Russ |title=Anthony Sowell's 'artwork' for sale online |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/269097/45/Anthony-Sowells-artwork-for-sale-online |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130209091137/http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/269097/45/Anthony-Sowells-artwork-for-sale-online |dead-url=yes |archive-date=February 9, 2013 |date=November 12, 2010 |accessdate=November 13, 2012 }}</ref> The letter was to the people of Cleveland. Sowell railed against former trial judge and newly elected Cuyahoga County prosecutor Tim McGinty and addressed the issue of artwork which he had recently sent to the owner of the website.<ref>{{cite news |first=Peter |last=Krouse |title= Serial killer Anthony Sowell's artwork back on 'murderabilia' website |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2012/11/serial_killer_anthony_sowells.html |date=November 12, 2010 |accessdate=November 13, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Kevin |last=Freeman |title= Death Row Drawings: Sowell's Controversial Artwork is Selling |url=http://fox8.com/2012/11/13/death-row-drawings-sowells-controversial-artwork-is-selling/ |date=November 12, 2010 |accessdate=November 13, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Dick |last=Russ |title=Anthony Sowell 'artwork' buyer defends purchase |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/269171/45/Anthony-Sowell-artwork-buyer-defends-purchase |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130209074921/http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/269171/45/Anthony-Sowell-artwork-buyer-defends-purchase |dead-url=yes |archive-date=February 9, 2013 |date=November 12, 2010 |accessdate=November 13, 2012 }}</ref>

{{pp-30-500|small=yes}} {{use dmy dates|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox member of the Knesset |image = AYELET SHAKED.jpg |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1976|5|7}} |birth_place = [[Tel Aviv]], [[Israel]] |Knesset(s) = [[Israeli legislative election, 2013|19]], [[Israeli legislative election, 2015|20]] |party1 = [[The Jewish Home]] |partyyears1 = 2013–present |minister1 = [[Justice Ministry (Israel)|Minister of Justice]] |ministeryears1 = 2015–present }}
'''Ayelet Shaked''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|ɑː|j|ɛ|l|ɛ|t|_|ʃ|ɑː|k|ɛ|d}}; {{lang-he|איילת שקד}}; born 7 May 1976) is an Israeli politician, activist, and computer engineer. She has served as a member of the [[Knesset]] for [[The Jewish Home]] since 2013, and as [[Justice Ministry (Israel)|Minister of Justice]] since 2015. Although representing a religious party, Shaked identifies as a [[Jewish secularism|secular]] politician. She is the only secular woman in her party. She began her career in the [[Tel Aviv]] [[high-tech]] industry, working as an engineer at [[Texas Instruments]].<ref name="Talks with a Tel Aviv Settler">[http://www.haaretz.co.il/1.1736670 Talks with a Tel Aviv Settler] ''Haaretz'', 22.06.2012</ref><ref>[http://www.nrg.co.il/online/54/ART2/417/508.html Meet the most surprising candidate of "Jewish Home"] [[Maariv (newspaper)|NRG]] 11/26/2012</ref> In 2010 she established the [[My Israel]] extra-parliamentary movement with [[Naftali Bennett]] and led it until May 2012.
She is considered one of Israel's most active and influential legislators,<ref>''Parliamentary Affairs: Not-so-new politics'', By Lahav Harkov, 08/01/2013</ref> and initiated and drafted laws including Israel's 2016 NGO law, its comprehensive law against terrorism, a version of the basic law proposal on Israel as the nation-state of the Jewish people, as well as a law limiting the powers of the Israeli Supreme Court. Widely viewed as a potential future Prime Minister, in the opinion of ''[[Haaretz]]'', "she is poised to be Israel’s most successful female Israeli politician since [[Golda Meir]]".<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-1.811185 Who’s Afraid of Ayelet Shaked? Meet the Secular Jewish Nationalist Who Could Be Israel’s Prime Minister] Haaretz, Allison Kaplan Sommer, 8 September 2017.</ref>
==Early life and career== Shaked was born '''Ayelet Ben Shaul''' in Tel Aviv to a well-educated upper-middle-class Israeli family. Her paternal grandmother immigrated to Israel from [[Iraq]] as a single mother in the 1950s as part of the [[Jewish exodus from Arab and Muslim countries]], carefully investing her money in property and the education of her children.<ref name="השקד פורחת">[http://atmag.co.il/%D7%90%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%A0%D7%94-%D7%95%D7%99%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%99/%D7%90%D7%A0%D7%A9%D7%99%D7%9D/%D7%94%D7%A9%D7%A7%D7%93-%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%A8%D7%97%D7%AA השקד פורחת]</ref> Her father was an accountant and voted [[Likud]].<ref name=jtaWho>Julie Wiener, [http://www.jta.org/2015/05/07/news-opinion/the-telegraph/who-is-ayelet-shaked-israels-new-justice-minister Who is Ayelet Shaked, Israel's new justice minister?], Jewish Telegraphic Agency, May 7, 2015</ref><ref name="JRudorenNYTimes05152015"/><ref>Naomi Zeveloff, [http://forward.com/news/israel/213348/can-ayelet-shaked-sell-secular-israel-on-the-far-r/ Can Ayelet Shaked Sell (Secular) Israel on the Far Right?], ''The Forward'', 26 January 2015</ref> Shaked describes herself as 'half-Iraqi and proud of it'.<ref name="השקד פורחת"/> Her mother, a Bible teacher, was from a center-left [[Ashkenazi Jews|Ashkenazi]] family whose ancestors migrated to Palestine from the [[Russian Empire]] and [[Romania]] in the 1880s as part of the [[First Aliyah]].
She grew up in the upper middle class [[Bavli]] neighbourhood of Tel Aviv. She identified her political awakening and right-wing orientation to when she was 8 years old, after watching a television debate between [[Yitzhak Shamir]] and [[Shimon Peres]], where she supported the right-wing views of Shamir.<ref name="JRudorenNYTimes05152015"/><ref>{{cite news |date=18 January 2013 |url=http://www.star10.co.il/print?c0=20601 |script-title=he:ראיון אישי עם איילת שקד: משהו חדש מתחיל בפוליטיקה הישראלית. |language=he |trans-title= Interview with Ayelet Shaked: something new begins in Israeli politics. |publisher=North Star}}</ref> As a teenager, she was a main instructor in the [[Hebrew Scouts Movement in Israel]]. At high-school, she held right-wing views but was not highly political.<ref name="nrg.co.il">[http://www.nrg.co.il/online/54/ART2/417/508.html Meet the most surprising candidate of the "Jewish Home"] NRG, 26/11/2012</ref>
She served in the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] as an infantry instructor in the [[Golani Brigade]],<ref name="JRudorenNYTimes05152015"/> serving in the 12th ''Barak'' (''Lightning'') battalion and [[Israeli Special Forces Units#Infantry Corps|Sayaret Golani]] (the special forces unit within the Golani Brigade).<ref name="nrg.co.il"/> It was while she was in the army, that her right-wing views were strengthened.<ref name="nrg.co.il"/> At [[Tel Aviv University]], she obtained a [[BSc]] in [[electrical engineering]] and [[computer science]]. She began her career in the Tel Aviv high-tech industry,<ref name="Talks with a Tel Aviv Settler"/> working as a [[software engineer]] at [[Texas Instruments]] and later becoming manager of the company's marketing.
[[File:Reuven Rivlin opened the consultations after the 2015 elections with the HaBayit HaYehudi (2)shaked1.jpg|thumbnail|Ayelet Shaked with [[Reuven Rivlin]], [[President of Israel]] in consultations after the elections, 23 March 2015]]
==Public career== From 2006 to 2008, she was office director for the office of [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]. In 2010 she established [[My Israel]] with [[Naftali Bennett]] and led it until May 2012.
From the end of 2011, she campaigned against [[illegal immigration from Africa to Israel]], saying that it poses a threat to the state and also involves severe economic damage.<ref>{{cite news |author=Ayelet Shaked |date=16 November 2011 |url=http://www.mako.co.il/video-blogs-ayelet-shaked/Article-3eef040728ca331006.htm |title=בקרוב: מאה אלף מסתננים בישראל] |language=he |trans-title=Soon: a hundred thousand infiltrators in Israel |publisher=Mako}}</ref> She also campaigned against [[Galei Tzahal]] saying it had a "left leaning agenda".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.jewishjournal.com/israel/article/an_interview_with_ayelet_shaked_20120815|title=An interview with Ayelet Shaked - Israel|work=Jewish Journal}}</ref>
In January 2012 Shaked was elected to serve as a member of the [[Likud]]'s Central Committee; however, in June 2012 she resigned and joined the Jewish Home. On 14 November 2012 she won third place in the party's primaries, and was placed in the fifth spot on the Jewish Home list for the [[Israeli legislative election, 2013|2013 elections]]. With the list winning 12 seats, Shaked became the only secular Jewish Home MK. She subsequently joined the Economic Affairs Committee, the House Committee, and the Committee on Foreign Workers, and served as an alternate member on the Finance Committee. She also chaired the Knesset committee for the Enforcement of the Security Service Law and the National-Civilian Service Law and the Special Committee for the Equal Sharing of the Burden Bill.
In June 2014, Shaked posted an article by the late Israeli writer [[Uri Elitzur]] on [[Facebook]].<ref name="Exposing militant leftist propaganda">{{cite news |url=http://www.jpost.com/Opinion/Op-Ed-Contributors/Exposing-militant-leftist-propaganda-363062 |title=Exposing militant leftist propaganda |last=Shaked |first=Ayelet |date=16 July 2014 |work=The Jerusalem Post |accessdate=18 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="Israel's new justice minister considers all Palestinians to be 'the enemy'"/><ref name="Who is Ayelet Shaked, Israel's new justice minister?"/><ref name=foreignPolicy/> The Facebook post was variously described in the media as calling Palestinian children "little snakes" and appearing to justify mass punishment of Palestinians.<ref name="Israel's new justice minister considers all Palestinians to be 'the enemy'">{{cite news|last1=Tharoor|first1=Ishaan|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/worldviews/wp/2015/05/07/israels-new-justice-minister-considers-all-palestinians-to-be-the-enemy/ |title=Israel's new justice minister considers all Palestinians to be 'the enemy' |work=The Washington Post|date=7 May 2014 |accessdate=12 May 2015}}</ref><ref name="Who is Ayelet Shaked, Israel's new justice minister?">{{cite news|last1=Wiener|first1=Julie|title=Who is Ayelet Shaked, Israel's new justice minister?|url=http://www.jta.org/2015/05/07/news-opinion/the-telegraph/who-is-ayelet-shaked-israels-new-justice-minister|publisher=Jewish Telegraph Agency|date=7 May 2014}}</ref><ref name=foreignPolicy>{{cite news|last1=O'Grady|first1=Siobhan|title=The New Face of Israel's Hard Right|url=https://foreignpolicy.com/2015/05/07/the-new-face-of-israel-hard-right-netanyahu-ayelet-shaked/ |work=Foreign Policy |date=7 May 2014 |accessdate=12 May 2015}}</ref><ref name="dailysabah">{{cite news |last= |first= |url=http://www.dailysabah.com/mideast/2014/07/14/mothers-of-all-palestinians-should-also-be-killed-says-israeli-politician|title='Mothers of all Palestinians should also be killed,' says Israeli politician|work= |location= |newspaper=[[Daily Sabah]] |date=14 July 2014|accessdate=13 October 2015}}</ref><ref name="independent">{{cite news |last=Hillel|first=Mira Bar|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/why-im-on-the-brink-of-burning-my-israeli-passport-9600165.html|title=Why I'm on the brink of burning my Israeli passport|newspaper=[[The Independent]] |date=11 July 2014|accessdate=13 October 2015}}</ref> Based upon the Facebook post, the then Turkish Prime Minister [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] said that Shaked's mindset was no different from Adolf Hitler's.<ref name=foreignPolicy /><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.605255|title=Israeli Politician Declares 'War' on 'the Palestinian People'|work=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref> Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu condemned Erdoğan’s comments, stating "Erdogan's anti-Semitic comments profaned the memory of the Holocaust." The leader of Israeli leftist [[Meretz]] party, [[Zehava Gal-On]], suggested that "because of the presidential election Erdoğan has lost control."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.jpost.com/Diplomacy-and-Politics/Netanyahu-finally-calls-out-Erdogan-for-anti-Semitic-statements-363529 |title=Netanyahu finally calls out Erdogan for anti-Semitic statements |last=Keinon |first=Herb |date=20 July 2014 |newspaper=The Jerusalem Post}}</ref> Shaked stated that her post was portrayed falsely in the media, especially in that the article was presented as her own words rather than Elitzur's. She said, "I refer specifically to 'Daily Beast' writer Gideon Resnick, who so misrepresented the facts in one of my recent Facebook posts, one has to wonder if his hatred for my country hasn’t rendered him outright useless to his website and his readers."<ref name="Exposing militant leftist propaganda"/>
In 2015, Shaked won the primary election for the Jewish Home Party, which was considered an achievement as a secular female politician within a religious party.<ref>[http://www.timesofisrael.com/shaked-top-vote-getter-in-jewish-home-primaries Shaked is top vote-getter in Jewish Home primaries] ''The Times of Israel'', 15 January 2015</ref>
==Minister of Justice== Shaked was placed third on the Jewish Home list for the [[Israeli legislative election, 2015|2015 elections]],<ref>[http://www.bechirot20.gov.il/election/Candidates/Pages/OneListCandidates.aspx?LPF=Search&WebId=6adadc15-e476-480b-9746-04490aedeb0f&ListID=ba72a662-765c-45af-9d48-fb68080956af&ItemID=57&FieldID=ListNickname_GxS_Text The Jewish Home] CEC</ref> and was re-elected to the Knesset. On 6 May 2015, it was reported that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had agreed to appoint Shaked as Minister of Justice as part of a plan to form a new coalition government.<ref>{{cite news |last=Azulay |first=Moran |date=6 May 2015 |title=Netanyahu gives Bayit Yehudi's Shaked the Justice Ministry, but with limited powers |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4654283,00.html |publisher=[[Ynetnews]] |location=[[Tel Aviv]], [[Israel]] |access-date=6 May 2015|quote=Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu agreed Wednesday to appoint Bayit Yehudi MK Ayelet Shaked as justice minister, but insisted that her powers be curtailed.}}</ref><ref name="TimesIsrael05062015">{{cite news |last= |first= |date=6 May 2015 |title=In the 11th hour, Netanyahu finalizes 61-strong coalition |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/in-the-11th-hour-netanyahu-finalizes-61-strong-coalition/ |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |location=[[Jerusalem]] |access-date=6 May 2015|quote=Prime minister reaches deal with Jewish home's Bennett, finalizing a right-wing government; two men set to deliver a statement; Ayelet Shaked will be named justice minister.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Heller |first=Jeffrey |date=6 May 2015 |title=Netanyahu clinches deal to form new Israeli government |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/05/06/us-israel-politics-idUSKBN0NR29R20150506 |publisher=Reuters |location=London |access-date=6 May 2015 }}</ref> Shaked took office as Justice Minister on 14 May 2015.<ref name="JRudorenNYTimes05152015">{{cite news |last=Rudoren |first=Jodi |date=15 May 2015 |title=Ayelet Shaked, Israel's New Justice Minister, Shrugs Off Critics in Her Path |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/16/world/middleeast/ayelet-shaked-israels-new-justice-minister-shrugs-off-critics-in-her-path.html?_r=0 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=16 May 2015|quote=Ms. Shaked still lives in the Bavli neighborhood of Tel Aviv where she grew up. Her mother, a Bible teacher, voted for center-left parties, and her father, an accountant of Iraqi descent who was born in Iran, for the right-leaning Likud. Ms. Shaked dates her own political awakening to age 8, when she admired the hawkish Yitzhak Shamir in a televised debate.}}</ref>
In July 2015, Shaked announced that she was forming a committee to create a stable legal structure for the [[Israeli settlements]] in the [[West Bank]].<ref name=YnetNewsAmbiguity>{{cite news |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4682628,00.html|title=Justice Minister: Remove legal ambiguity from settlements|publisher=Ynetnews |author=Tova Tzimoki|date=21 July 2015}}</ref> The formation of the committee was agreed upon in the coalition agreement between Bayit Yehudi and Likud.<ref name=YnetNewsAmbiguity/> She has stated: "There are many areas in Judea and Samaria, whose legal status has not been organized. Its time to remove the legal ambiguity, and allow the residents of Judea and Samaria, many of whom live in settlements that were built by the Israeli government, to live without the persistent fear of challenges to their property ownership".<ref name=YnetNewsAmbiguity/> The legal status of the West Bank is disputed; the Palestinians, the UN, human rights organisations and most of the international community consider it to be occupied Palestinian territory.
In January 2016, Shaked sponsored a bill in the Knesset that would require non-governmental organizations ("NGOs") that receive a majority of their funding from "foreign government entities" to be so labeled. In an interview in ''[[The Washington Post]]'' she stated that the law would foster transparency by giving the public the right "to know which NGOs are receiving most of their support from foreign governments and therefore representing foreign government interests."<ref>{{cite news|newspaper=The Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2016/01/31/israel-doesnt-trust-ngos-that-get-money-from-u-s-and-europe-heres-why/|title=Israel doesn't trust NGOs that get money from U.S. and Europe. Here's why|first=William|last=Booth|date=31 January 2016|access-date=31 January 2016}}</ref>
In June 2016 the Israeli Knesset passed a comprehensive [[Anti-terrorism legislation|law against terrorism]], forbidding any kind of terrorism and support of terrorism, and setting severe punishments for terrorists. The law also regulates legal efforts against terrorism and [[counter-terrorism]] measures. The law was sponsored and promoted by Justice minister Shaked.<ref name="Israel-anti-terror-law">{{cite news|title=Terror bill passes into law|url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Terror-bill-passes-into-law-456857 |work=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |date=16 June 2016 |accessdate=16 June 2016}}</ref>
=== Views on Jewish identity and democracy ===
Referencing the Knesset's basic law that Israel will be a Jewish and democratic state, Shaked opposes the view that the two values are in any way incompatible, arguing that "alongside the view that there is a constant struggle and a clash of civilizations between “Jewish” and “democratic,” I believe we can propose another model."<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref>
Shaked argues that the key of concepts of [[property rights]], the rejection of the [[divine right of kings]], the importance of the separation of powers, and civil liberty are a byproduct of the Jewish philosophical tradition.<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref> She states: "On what did [[John Locke|Locke]] base the right to property if not the chapters on creation? After all, Locke’s [[Second Treatise of Government]] is inspired by a close textual reading of [[The Book of Genesis]]."<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref> She concludes that, it was "not primarily Roman law or the democratic tradition of the Athenian polis that shaped and forged the modern democratic tradition in Europe or the United States, but Jewish tradition—joined, of course, by other traditions."<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref>
She proposes that "it is precisely when we wish to promote advanced processes of democratization in Israel that we must deepen its Jewish identity. These identities clearly do not contradict each other; on the contrary, I believe that they strengthen each other."<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref>
=== Zionism === In a controversial 2017 speech to the Israel Bar Association, Shaked stated that the Israeli judicial branch operates as if in a "dream," adopting a "utopian and universal worldview... Only a moral and political revolution of the magnitude of the revolution we saw in the 90s, but one reaffirming the accomplishments of Zionism and its unchanging positions, may turn this problematic tide." She argued that the [[Basic Law proposal: Israel as the Nation-State of the Jewish People]], of which she is an advocate and architect, will lead to a "moral and political revolution in Israel... It's a call to rouse from this dream. It's an overall perception bringing back the principles of our founding fathers to the forefront of law. It moves Zionism and the deepest and most basic components of our identity from the blind spot it currently occupies in the judicial realm to its rightful place: under the spotlight."<ref>[https://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-5009369,00.html Shaked denounces HCJ illegal aliens ruling, calls for new constitutional revolution] Gilad Morag and Tova Tzimuki, Published: 29.08.17, Ynet</ref> Shaked states that "Individual rights are almost sacred to me, but not devoid of context, not when cut off from our Israeli uniqueness, our national missions, our history, and our Zionist challenges.".<ref>[http://www.mako.co.il/news-military/politics-q3_2017/Article-5bbb4572d5e2e51004.htm Shaked: Zionism will not bend its head] Offer Haddad, Channel 2, Posted 29/08/17</ref>
=== Judicial views ===
Shaked seeks to limit the power of the Israeli judiciary. She argues that role of the judiciary needs to be delineated and restricted. "Is it still correct to say of the judiciary in Israel what [[Alexander Hamilton]] said about the court that he knew, that it “has no influence over either the sword or the purse”? Is it really true that the judiciary in Israel has “no direction either of the strength or of the wealth of the society”? To my mind, this is very doubtful. In fact, it is inconceivable to me that a judicial body that bears no responsibility for filling the purse permits itself to empty it, but unfortunately, this is the situation in Israel today ... The new tracks that I seek to lay—carefully, while protecting the independence and dignity of the court—are meant to define more precisely the routes of each of the branches, legislative, executive, and judicial, and thus to enable regular traffic and prevent future collisions."<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref>
She writes, referencing the arguments of [[Alexis de Tocqueville]], that the long-term damage of normalizing judicial intervention has to be distinguished from the justness of any particular legal decision. "[O]nly a person with real patience who knows that the advantage of democratic government lies not in its immunity from errors, but in the fact that its errors can be corrected in the long term ... only a person like this could understand the enormous benefits of long-term governance power and what de Tocqueville meant when he spoke of the healthy influence of the government’s ability to govern effectively. Tocqueville’s words must be borne in mind as we lay the new tracks regulating the relations between the Supreme Court and the other branches of government. The healthy influence of governance emerges in ways that are not obvious, and certainly not in a brief focused glance, which misses the aggregate damages caused when the court repeatedly strikes down the products of the government and the Knesset."<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref>
Shaked concludes that the judicial system must "give enough power and leeway to elected officials while minimizing the harm to the individual and giving maximum consideration to the individual’s freedom to shape his life as he wishes".<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref>
Sometimes nicknamed the "Iron Lady" because of her intransigence in repressing crimes committed by Palestinians as well as for her nationalist positions,<ref>{{cite web|language=French|title=Ayelet Shaked, la "Dame de fer" d'Israël|url=http://www.liberation.fr/planete/2015/07/28/ayelet-shaked-la-dame-de-fer-d-israel_1355090|website=[[Libération]]|date=28 July 2015|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref> she supports the death penalty for individuals who have committed terrorist acts,<ref>{{cite web|title=Israeli ministers call for death penalty for Halamish terrorist|url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Politics-And-Diplomacy/Israeli-ministers-call-for-death-penalty-for-Halamish-terrorist-500486|website=[[Jerusalem Post]]|date=23 July 2017|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref> including for Jewish who allegedly killed Palestinian children.<ref>{{cite web|title=Justice Minister: Jewish Extremists Who Killed Palestinian Infant Should Face Death Penalty|url=https://www.haaretz.com/shaked-jewish-extremists-who-killed-palestinian-infant-should-face-death-penalty-1.5384868|website=[[Haaretz]]|date=9 August 2015|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Justice minister backs death penalty for terrorists who killed Palestinian baby|url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/justice-minister-backs-death-penalty-for-terrorists-who-killed-palestinian-baby/|website=[[The Times of Israel]]|date=8 August 2015|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref> However, she considers that the death penalty should only apply in the most extreme cases.<ref>{{cite web|title=Shaked: No need for new death penalty legislation|url=https://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-5066427,00.html|website=[[Ynetnews]]|date=1 April 2018|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref>
=== Economic views === Shaked argues that the Israeli economy is insufficiently capitalistic. As part of a 20 page treatise she wrote in an academic law journal in 2016 on the structure of the Israeli legal system, she argues that the Israeli economy is suffering from massive over-regulation, and that the fight to de-regulate the economy is a constant uphill battle. {{cquote|"The state’s ability to finance its services depends first and foremost on the value and profit created by entrepreneurs, by the great industrialists, by the various employers, and by the workers. Yet regulation, so beloved of lawmakers, is strangling them and placing the country’s growth in grave danger... [T]he cumulative wisdom of the masses will always be greater than that of the state’s experts, that the popular mechanisms will always be more flexible, faster, more responsive, and more adaptable than the mechanisms of the state. The law, therefore, must attempt to reflect these mechanisms and not try to create more successful alternatives... The railroad tracks of legislation to which we have become accustomed lead to an erosion of citizens’ liberty and a series of restrictions on the economy by increasing the Knesset’s ability to criminalize various acts. In labor law, between 2011 and 2013, in an 18-month period, 60 new criminal offenses were added which an employer could be accused of as a result of actions carried out during his business activities. And this is far from being all: in environmental protection, within 24 months, 65 new criminal offenses were added. Overall, the numbers are alarming... The areas of freedom in this world, which create the enormous wealth we enjoy, would be more and more reduced because of a government apparatus."<ref name="Pathways to Governability">[http://hashiloach.org.il/wp-content/themes/hashiloach_landing/dist/images/article-shaked.pdf Pathways to Governability] by Ayelet Shaked, Hashiloach, October 2016, Issue 1</ref>}}
==== Opposition to executive pay limits ==== Shaked opposes the imposition of limits on executive pay. She argues that limiting executive pay means that "banks and pension funds... are having trouble finding talented managers interested in being company officers. Good senior managers are looking for new directions, and are seeking to join other sectors to which the law does not apply, they are having trouble finding talented managers interested in being company officers. Good senior managers are looking for new directions, and are seeking to join other sectors to which the law does not apply... I'm asking you to refrain from enacting legislation where it is not needed. Unnecessary legislation is harmful legislation. It harms the economy on a macro scale and the individual on a micro scale."<ref>[http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-shaked-denounces-exec-pay-limits-1001187381 Shaked denounces exec pay limits] 4 May 2017 18:32, Chen Ma'anit, Globes Israel</ref>
=== Kurdish Independence ===
Shaked has repeatedly stressed her support for Kurdish independence.<ref>[http://www.kurdistan24.net/en/news/1fadf0d1-05c6-4a2e-8772-d4f63de07de2/israeli-minister-calls-for-kurdish-statehood Israeli minister calls for Kurdish statehood] Kurdistan 24 Wednesday, 20 January 2016</ref> In an unusual intervention in foreign policy, Shaked called for an independent [[Kurdistan]]. Shaked says as the [[Sykes-Picot Agreement]] breaks apart, "the greatest opportunity that stands before us could come from strengthening the connections with the Kurdish nation." Shaked says, “the Jewish and Kurdish nations share a history... of mutual respect, mutual interests,” including fighting Islamic State.<ref>[http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Politics-And-Diplomacy/Shaked-dives-into-foreign-policy-pushes-for-alliance-with-Kurds-405506 Shaked dives into foreign policy, pushes for alliance with Kurds] Jerusalem Post, By YONAH JEREMY BOB, 06/09/2015</ref> Shaked has additionally cited the high number of women serving in Kurdish armed forces.<ref>{{cite AV media | people = Ayelet Shaked | date = 2015 | year = | title = Israel's Law & Justice | trans-title = | medium = Video | language = English | url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eeHzj8jIrmU | access-date = 18 October 2016 | format = | time = | location = Herzliya | publisher = IDC Herzliya | id = | isbn = | oclc = | quote = "I don't know if you noticed this, but the commander of the forces in Kobani is actually a woman commander. And you can see this through the percentages of women in the army." | ref = }}</ref>
=== Cannabis decriminalization === Shaked supports and has legislated for the decriminalization of cannabis consumption. In 2017, as Minister of Justice, Shaked submitted legislation to decriminalize the recreational use of cannabis.<ref>[http://www.jta.org/2017/03/05/news-opinion/israel-middle-east/israels-cabinet-votes-to-decriminalize-recreational-marijuana-use Israel’s Cabinet votes to decriminalize recreational marijuana use] March 5, 2017, JTA</ref> On successfully passing the legislation, Shaked said "Whether one supports use of cannabis or is opposed, it is wrong to judge cannabis users per criminal law and its derivatives."<ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2017/03/06/health/israel-decriminalizes-cannabis-marijuana/ Israel makes it official: Cannabis is not a crime] By [[Oren Liebermann]] and Kara Fox, CNN</ref>
==Personal life== Shaked is married and has two children and lives in [[Bavli]], Tel Aviv. Her husband is a fighter-pilot in the [[Israeli Air Force]].<ref name=jtaWho /> She is an admirer of [[Steve Jobs]]. She was influenced by [[Ayn Rand]], in particular ''[[The Fountainhead]]'' and ''[[Atlas Shrugged]]''.<ref name="Talks with a Tel Aviv Settler"/> She describes her personality as 'intellectual' and 'systematic'.<ref name="השקד פורחת"/>
==Awards and recognition== *In 2012, Shaked won the Abramowitz Israeli Prize for Media Criticism.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.jewishpress.com/indepth/interviews-and-profiles/an-interview-with-ayelet-shaked-secular-candidate-for-habayit-hayehudi/2012/08/15/ |title=An Interview with Ayelet Shaked, Secular Candidate for HaBayit HaYehudi |date=15 August 2012 |last=Meltzer |first=Yoel |newspaper=[[The Jewish Press]]}}</ref> *In 2012, Shaked was included in the ''[[Globes]]'' list of the 50 most influential women.<ref>{{cite news|title=Victory stems from the ability to break stigmas |url=http://www.globes.co.il/news/article.aspx?did=1000803337 |newspaper=Globes |date=5 December 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140904031115/http://www.globes.co.il/news/article.aspx?did=1000803337 |archivedate=4 September 2014 |df=dmy }}</ref> *In 2013, Shaked ranked 1st (with [[Shelly Yachimovich]]) as outstanding Knesset Member for the summer session by the [[Knesset Channel]].<ref>{{cite news |title=כבוד לבית היהודי: איילת שקד - הח"כית המצטיינת במושב האחרון |language=he |trans-title=Jewish respect to: Ayelet Shaked - outstanding MK last session |url=http://www.kipa.co.il/now/53192.html|date=29 August 2013}}</ref> *In 2014, Shaked ranked 2nd as outstanding Knesset Member for the winter session by the [[Knesset Channel]].<ref>{{cite news |title=ירוג השרים והח"כים: בנט ושקד בשלישייה הפותחת |language=he |trans-title=Rating ministers and MKs: Bennett and Shaked trio opens |url=http://www.kipa.co.il/now/56207.html |date=27 March 2014}}</ref> *In 2015 ''[[The Jerusalem Post]]'' ranked Shaked as the 33rd most prominent Jewish person in the world.<ref>Maariv Weekend, 22 May 2015</ref> *In 2015 the magazine ''Forbes Israel'' ranked Shaked as the 5th most prominent woman in Israel.<ref><bdi lang=he dir=rtl>מעריב השבוע</bdi>, 19 August 2015.</ref> *In 2015 Shaked was elected as "Woman of the Year" in Israel by ''Lady Globes'' magazine.<ref>{{cite news|date=8 September 2015 |author=Vered Ramon Rivlin |title=אשת השנה של "ליידי גלובס": שרת המשפטים איילת שקד |language=he |trans-title="Lady Globes" Woman of the Year: Justice Minister Ayelet Shaked |url=http://www.globes.co.il/news/article.aspx?did=1001067517 |work=Lady Globes |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160814093811/http://www.globes.co.il/news/article.aspx?did=1001067517 |archivedate=14 August 2016 |df=dmy }}</ref> *In 2016, Shaked was ranked as the sixth most influential person in Israel, by [[Maariv]]. *In 2017, Shaked was chosen as 'Woman of the year', by Forbes Israel. *In 2017, Shaked was chosen as 'Israel's most influential woman', by [[Globes]].<ref>[http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/235515 Ayelet Shaked chosen as Israel's 'most influential woman'] Tzvi Lev, 14/09/17</ref>

'''Bryson Foster''' is a noted teen [[activist]] who advocates and fundraises for the development of treatments for [[muscular dystrophy]].
Born June 28, 2000, Foster was diagnosed with [[Duchenne muscular dystrophy]] at age five.<ref name=Diagnosis>{{cite web|title=Bryson Foster|url=http://mda.org/about/bio/bryson-foster|publisher=Muscular Dystrophy Association|accessdate=6 April 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140407083549/http://mda.org/about/bio/bryson-foster|archivedate=7 April 2014|df=}}</ref>
==As MDA Goodwill Ambassador==
While attending a [[Muscular Dystrophy Association]] banquet at age nine, Foster asked if he could address the audience.<ref name=Speaking>{{cite news|last=Pacek|first=Jessica Groover|title=Concord natives out front in muscular dystrophy fight|url=http://m.independenttribune.com/community/article_4e291c70-25dd-11e3-a09e-001a4bcf6878.html?mode=jqm|accessdate=6 April 2014|newspaper=Independent Tribune|date=2013}}</ref> "I was anxious because I had never done it before, but when I got up there I didn't want to stop," he recalled.<ref name=Mobility>{{cite web|title=Bryson Foster: Making a muscle in his Q6 Edge|url=http://www.pridemobility.com/profiles/brysonfoster.asp|publisher=Pride Mobility Products Corporation|accessdate=6 April 2014}}</ref> To the surprise of his parents, Foster demonstrated a flair for communication; this in turn led to his choice as a national MDA [[Goodwill Ambassador]] (formerly known as an MDA [[Poster child|Poster Child]]) for two consecutive years (2012 and 2013).<ref name=Communication>{{cite news|last=Ruebens|first=Lindsay|title=Concord teen wraps up second year as MDA ambassador|url=http://www.charlotteobserver.com/2013/09/23/4326248/concord-teen-wraps-up-second-year.html#.U0DYKPldW9s#storylink=cpy|accessdate=6 April 2014|newspaper=Charlotte Observer|date=23 September 2013}}</ref>
In this role, Foster appeared on the annual MDA telethon, by then called the [[MDA Show of Strength]], visited numerous MDA corporate and business sponsors (including [[Lowe's]] and [[Harley-Davidson]]), and met many celebrities (including singers [[Taylor Swift]], [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]], [[Faith Hill]] and [[Tim McGraw]], among others).<ref name="Speaking"/><ref name=Spokesperson>{{cite web|title=North Carolina Boy Returns as MDA National Goodwill Ambassador|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2013/2/prweb10478186.htm|publisher=PRWEB|accessdate=6 April 2014}}</ref> Foster also dealt frequently with the media and appeared in various MDA national promotional materials, including video [[public service announcements]] and MDA "[[shamrocks]]."
He has also served as MDA Goodwill Ambassador for the [[Charlotte, North Carolina|Charlotte]], [[North Carolina]], area.
"My favorite part of the job," explained Foster of his Goodwill Ambassador role, "is meeting new people and being able to thank the sponsors and supporters in person who help make an impact in the lives of people just like me. Every dollar and every cent really does count, and my mission is to have fun while spreading the word about MDA and its mission to help people living with muscle disease."<ref name="Spokesperson"/>
"Most kids my age don't come across opportunities like the ones I've had. . . ," he also observed. "I've experienced so many new things and met wonderful people along the way. I just want to keep speaking from my heart and doing what I love most to inspire people to support a cause that is close to me and my family."<ref name="Spokesperson"/>
==More recent activities==
Foster remains active as an MDA fundraiser and independent MD spokesperson, participating in such fundraising efforts as "Muscle Team, Muscle Walk, Lock-Ups, Shamrocks, mobile kickoffs, Fill the Boot, golf tournaments and social events."<ref name="Spokesperson"/> His walk team, Bryson's Bikers, has raised tens of thousands of dollars for the MDA.<ref name=Bikers>{{cite news|last=Darnell|first=Christina|title=Concord boy stumps for MDA|url=http://www.charlotteobserver.com/2012/02/19/3019628_concord-boy-stumps-for-mda.html#.U0DfDvldW9s|accessdate=7 April 2014|newspaper=Charlotte Observer|date=19 February 2012}}</ref>
==Other interests==
Foster's speaking skills resulted in a voice actor role in the [[Mobile application software|app]] ''Little Ashby: Star Reporter'', developed by “[[Entertainment Tonight]]” host and MDA National [[Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis|ALS]] Ambassador [[Nancy O'Dell]]. Foster performed the voice of child cameraperson "Arty."<ref name="Voice Actor">{{cite web|title=Bryson Animated Voiceover Debut|url=http://mda.org/page/bryson-animated-voiceover-debut|publisher=Muscular Dystrophy Association|accessdate=6 April 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140407083750/http://mda.org/page/bryson-animated-voiceover-debut|archivedate=7 April 2014|df=}}</ref>
A sports fan, Foster plans to pursue a career in sports, either as a football player, coach, or announcer.<ref name=Goals>{{cite web|last=Rivera|first=Steve|title=Bryson Foster Named MDA's 2012 National Goodwill Ambassador|url=http://quest.mda.org/news/bryson-foster-named-mdas-2012-national-goodwill-ambassador|publisher=Muscular Dystrophy Association|accessdate=6 April 2014}}</ref>

{{Expand Spanish|date=November 2010|Carlos de Amésquita}} '''Carlos de Amésquita''' (also '''Carlos de Amézqueta''' or '''Carlos de Amézola''') was a [[Spain|Spanish]] naval officer of the 16th century. He is remembered for his raid on English soil, known as the [[Raid on Mount's Bay]], during the [[Anglo-Spanish War (1585)|Anglo-Spanish War 1585–1604]].
Amésquita commanded three companies and four galleys (named ''Capitana'', ''Patrona'', ''Peregrina'' and ''Bazana''). They disembarked at [[Penmarch]] on July 26, and in [[Mount's Bay]] ([[Cornwall]]) on August 2.
After burning the town of [[Mousehole]], Amésquita and his men embarked on their galleys and sailed for two miles, after which they disembarked again, conquered and burned the fort of [[Penzance]] down, [[Newlyn]], and Penzance. They celebrated a mass at St. Mary Chapel at Penzance, where they promised to celebrate another mass after England had been defeated.
==See also== *[[Fernando Sánchez de Tovar]]
==External links== *[http://west-penwith.org.uk/raid.htm "The Spanish Attack"]
